Uses the English language in the workplace for presentations, negotiations, meetings, small talk, socializing, and writing reports.
Plans or designs the cohesive conglomeration of interrelated and interdependent parts of a system, that promotes business performance.

Plans and books meetings with proper notice. Distributes any reading in advance. Manages the meeting so that the time allocation is not exceeded and ensures relevant decisions are made or postponed. Circulates actions after the meeting.
Takes an active and self-starting approach to one's goals and tasks. Identifies what needs to be done and initiates action before being asked.
Shows the ability to endure and sustain a prolonged physical or mental effort.

Creates a shared understanding with stakeholders (e.g., internal and external) regarding goals, objectives, timeframes, and what needs to be delivered and by who. Continuously reinforces expectations and adjusts as necessary.

Invites people across all levels of the organization, regardless of their role or place in the hierarchy, to take ownership and accountability for projects and/or strategic design. Instills a culture of trust by enabling others to make autonomous decisions.

Understands that trust is an essential part of establishing effective human-machine teams. Sees Artificial Intelligence (AI) not only as a tool to facilitate human action but as a trusted partner to human operators.
Takes an interest in and develops a nuanced understanding of society, business, culture, and people. Applies this understanding and knowledge to various scenarios and situations.

Understands the perspective and feelings of others. Participates in meaningful communication and builds trust with employees, colleagues, partners, and customers to leverage increased sales, productivity, innovation, and a competitive advantage.

Takes an active and self-starting approach to goals and tasks. Identifies what needs to be done and takes action, even in difficult situations. Creates a safe environment through inclusive communication and mutual respect.

Fosters honest relationships and transparent communications and delivers work created with a passion for clients, customers, and their causes. Embraces one's true self as well as diverse viewpoints, education, experiences, and culture.

Gives timely written or oral feedback to others that is relevant, specific, realistic, positively framed, constructive, and kind. Offers continuous support to ensure that improvement and progress occur.

Controls and manages own thoughts, emotions, behaviors, and impulses in order to adapt to different situations, make informed decisions, achieve goals, and promote well-being. Makes conscious choices that align with own values, purpose, and goals, even in the face of internal or external challenges.

Makes conscious choices and decisions to direct own actions and thoughts toward a specific outcome, purpose, or goal. Takes thoughtful and purposeful actions rather than acting impulsively or without consideration.

Understands the various external and internal factors that influence a team's dynamics, performance, and outcomes. Establishes a common view of the situation a team is facing to support team effectiveness.

Ensures a team remains focused and connected to their goals by devising strategies to overcome adversities, tracking progress, learning from successes or failures, and encouraging continuous improvement.
Establishes and articulates a clear and compelling mission or purpose for a team to create a unifying direction, to inspire team members, and align their efforts toward achieving common goals.

Facilitates the collaborative process of setting clear and agreed-upon standards of behavior that align team members in terms of interpersonal interactions, communication management, decision-making, task delegation, and the assurance of mutual accountability.
Fosters a team environment where members feel comfortable addressing challenging issues, engaging in constructive disagreements, and managing conflict effectively.
Ensures that every team member is equally committed to achieving the team's goals, preventing instances where some members are highly engaged while others are disengaged.

Secures a team's tangible (e.g., office space, equipment, and budgets) and intangible assets (e.g., political support and authority) to deliver against desired outcomes. Finds ways for the team to succeed despite resource shortfalls.
Creates teams with an optimal number of people with the right skills, the right structure, clearly defined roles and responsibilities, and team members that show effective teamwork.

Determines the effectiveness of the team, both quantitatively and qualitatively, based on an evidence-based model, benchmarking performance against specific parameters that gauge the team's level of effectiveness.

Knowledge of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
Knowledge of business concepts, tools and techniques; ability to operate with a business mindset that complements one's functional specialty and keeps it in a business context.

Researches and analyzes account activity to assess levels of risk. Looks for patterns and checks authenticity to prevent scams from spreading further.
Develops policies, procedures, and processes to safeguard the organization's assets and prevent fraudulent behavior.
Works with stakeholders in a collaborative, flexible, and iterative manner to identify their needs. Accelerates audit cycles and ensures communication is frequent and informal.
Understands and describes an aircraft's aerodynamic layout or specific components.
Processes daily audit and compliance tasks using the organization's preferred audit and compliance platform.

competency_name: Audit and Compliance Policies and Procedures
description: Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide audit and compliance practices.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of audit and compliance, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Submits documented findings or audit reports to relevant parties as required.

Assesses an organization's compliance with relevant legislation, regulations, and industry standards. Covers business operations or processes, and financial and Information Technology (IT) systems. Documents all findings and prepares audit reports.

Investigates reported or discovered potential violations in a discrete and fair manner. Reports appropriately on findings and makes recommendations for remedial action. Follows up to ensure all deficiencies have been corrected.
Develops guidelines that detail the organization's processes for maintaining compliance with regulations, specifications, or legislation.

Ensures high levels of business compliance to relevant legislation, regulations, and industry standards with regards to ethical standards, employee health and safety, environmental sustainability, conflicts of interest, etc. Enforces these internal policies, procedures, and standards.

Educates management on the organization's exposure to legal penalties, financial forfeiture, and material loss when it fails to act under industry laws and regulations, internal policies, or prescribed best practices.
Develops consumer protection standards to encourage consistency across the business. Develops consumer protection strategies with business units and trains staff on these.

Conducts periodic internal audits to ensure the organization complies with all the relevant legislation and regulations. Conducts or directs internal investigation of compliance issues. Maintains documentation of compliance activities, including complaints received or investigation outcomes.
Develops and writes clear arguments and explanations for new products and renewal licenses. Prepares submissions of license variations and renewals to strict deadlines.

Administers a helpline where all officers and employees (including part-time and short-term employees) can consult, make reports of violations of laws and regulations or improper conduct, with the aim of prevention or remediation through early discovery. Provides a safe place for officers and employees without the fear of retribution.
Conducts cybersecurity governance assessments. Identifies areas of concern to the organization. Develops audit plans for the coming quarters.

Conducts a detailed investigation and analyzes, recovers, documents, and preserves evidence, in relation to a violation of relevant legislation or the rules of the organization. Detects and documents the course, reasons, culprits, and consequences.
Prevents, detects, and monitors fraud risks within the organization. Addresses suspected fraudulent activities through investigations.

Develops new techniques to prevent problems from happening by looking at data and thinking about fraudulent activity. Researches problems reported at other institutions to learn more about trending schemes and prevention methods.
Complies with the regulations for planning, conducting, and reporting on audits.
Identifies and implements software that helps to comply with financial regulations.

Serves as link between the organization, its products, and regulatory authorities. Ensures products, that are developed, manufactured, or distributed by organization, meets the required legislation. Advises scientists and manufacturers on regulatory requirements.
Keeps abreast with national and international regulatory developments. Implements any changes within the organization to ensure ongoing compliance.
Quantifies the loss potential of a business by multiplying the probability of an incident occurring by its potential losses.
Provides services that pertain to the manufacturing and operating of all types of aircraft.
Ensures compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX). Implements policies and procedures to prevent accounting errors and fraudulent practices within the organization.

Carries out a systematic inquiry to discover the facts of an incident, allegation, etc., to draw objective conclusions. Ensures due process is followed and that all supporting documentation or evidence is collected, examined, and stored.
Assesses processes and procedures to test and validate that the internal controls within the organization's risk frameworks do mitigate risk.
Gathers, analyzes, records, and submits data to a relevant authority to demonstrate that the organization or business area is compliant with the necessary regulatory requirements.
Understands all legislation and regulations affecting aircraft and airport operations (e.g., aircraft navigation and maintenance, air traffic control safety, and pilot licensing requirements).
Understands agricultural applications of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) technologies. Introduces and utilizes technologies in plant production in developing countries.

Applies research to solve real problems associated with agricultural product development throughout the world. Works with others in food, fiber, and animal research, production, and processing. Assists with the development, breeding, and nutrition in this field.
Studies the movement, distribution, and management of groundwater in the soil and rocks of the Earth's crust.

Maximizes plants' positive genetic traits to produce desirable effects. Continues to open new frontiers in agricultural production. Works towards the advancements in plant genetics and genomics. Uses growing methods to help support higher production and the cultivation of crops resistant to pests, pathogens, and drought, especially in developing countries with arid or challenging terrain.
Studies the relationship between living organisms, including humans, and their physical environment. Seeks to understand the vital connections between plants and animals and the world around them.
Creates, manages, uses, conserves, and repairs forests, woodlands, and associated resources for human and environmental benefits.

Ensures safe and efficient daily planning of flights. Coordinates technical and operational factors (e.g., the weather, overflight permits, route planning, aircraft performance, airport facilities, the aircraft's technical condition, and fuel requirements).
Ensures all aircraft are maintained, safe, operational, and their asset value maximized. Conducts all preventative and corrective work promptly.
Complies with all aviation safety and security policies and procedures to prevent malicious acts (e.g., terrorism). Also protects against accidents, errors, and unintentional defects.
Complies with all regulations on controlling civil air traffic including; on the ground (e.g., airports), in the air (e.g., air space and air traffic), as well as technical and safety requirements.
Conducts a careful and thorough assessment to ensure everything is correct and legal.

Coordinates trips and routes to ensure schedules and stops never overlap and time is efficiently utilized. Uses scheduling software if required. Distributes necessary plans and any necessary documentation for required personnel.

Plans for a proposed aircraft flight which includes fuel calculation (to ensure that the aircraft can safely reach the destination) and compliance with air traffic control requirements (to minimize the risk of midair collision).

Plans for preventative maintenance by either cabin crew or technicians, including annual inspections, 50/100-hour inspections, pre-flight checks, progressive inspections, and unscheduled aircraft inspections.
Understands the risks involved in the misinterpretation of aircraft attitude, altitude, or airspace and continuously refreshes one's understanding of the risks associated with spatial orientation.
Understands aircraft systems, structures, functional tests, and calibrated aircraft test equipment to conduct aircraft systems troubleshooting and defects rectification.
Manages flight and crew scheduling, fleet assignment, and aircraft routing, including planning for irregular operations and challenges (e.g., crew recovery).

Uses the digital data link system for the transmission of messages between aircraft and ground stations, e.g., Air Traffic Control (ATC), Aeronautical Operational Control (AOC), and Airline Administrative Control (AAC).

Studies current and forecasted weather conditions for all altitudes, including the direction and speed of the wind, cloud cover, and precipitation. Highlights the risk involved in adverse weather conditions.
Devises strategies and initiatives to gather and provide information on airline commercial and operational priorities and the administration of airports and airlines.
Conveys clear messages to prevent collisions between aircraft or with obstructions in the maneuvering area. Expedites and maintains an orderly flow of air traffic.
Performs assemblies, subassemblies and related tasks that may include material procurement, process development, manufacturing, and testing.
Alters the existing design, adds ornamental features, and plants trees and shrubs in order to make a garden or other piece of land more attractive.
Understands and uses a particular class or kind of industrial machine.
Abrades, cuts, drills, forms, grinds, and/or shapes pieces of metal or other material using machine tools (e.g., lathes, power saws, and presses).
Uses hands in a skillful, coordinated way to grasp and manipulate objects and demonstrate small, precise movements.
Understands and uses tools and machines.
Grinds, cuts, presses, or crushes material in a milling machine.
Extracts valuable minerals or geological materials from the Earth.
Installs, operates, and maintains machinery, apparatus, and utensils used in the packaging process.
Attaches pipes to walls, structures, and fixtures (e.g., radiators or tanks) using brackets, clamps, tools, or welding equipment.
Installs and maintains systems of pipes and other apparatus required for the water supply, heating, and sanitation in a building.

Uses data, statistical algorithms, and machine learning techniques to identify and predict the future performance of machines based on historical data. Uses this information to provide a best assessment of what will happen in the future.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Collects used material, breaks it down, and reuses material that would usually have been thrown away.
Designs, produces, and distributes textiles, yarn, cloth, and clothing from natural and synthetic materials.
Prunes or treats old or damaged trees in order to preserve them.
Removes metal that is outside the workpiece's diameter using a cutting tool.

Removes and destroys or stores damaged, used, or other unwanted domestic, agricultural, or industrial products, and substances. Disposes either through burning, burial at landfill sites, or sea, and recycling.
Fuses metal or thermoplastic materials.
Conducts testing to establish a minimum reliability for an assembly or one of its components. Demonstrates the corresponding confidence one has in this test.
Utilizes computer technology like numeric controls or Computer Numerical Controls (CNCs) to track the production quantity and run time of the equipment.
Creates holes in metal using circular cylinders. Uses machinery to make circular holes in the ground to find water or oil.
Controls and steers the movement of a vehicle.
Installs and maintains systems of electrical wiring and parts in buildings.
Installs equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.
Uses fabrication technology to build a metal structure by cutting, machining, welding, assembling, and stamping.
Manufactures, contracts, assembles, and fits components for machinery. Works with metal and repairs parts.

Operates and manages industrial trucks to load and unload materials. Makes deliveries and moves materials to and from storage areas, machines, and loading docks into cars, trucks, or storage facilities.
Removes the remaining unwanted materials from the surface of a product to improve the finish of the surface and tighten up the tolerance.

Combines the strength, speed, repeatability, and precision of automation with the intelligence, flexibility, and skill of human operators. Obtains hybrid systems with the highest potential in terms of production process and human well-being.
Installs and maintains heating, ventilation, and air conditioning equipment to provide heating and cooling to buildings.
Keeps the right number of parts and products in stock to avoid shortages, overstock, and other costly problems.

Uses a systematic approach to source, store, and sell inventory, whether it is raw materials or finished goods. Ensures the company has the right stock, at the right levels, in the right place, at the right time, and at the right cost, as well as price.
Focuses on next-generation remote banking solutions that enable customer self-service and reduce unnecessary costs.
Develops an Anti-Money Laundering (AML) policy to prevent and expose suspicious financial activity by criminals. Monitors compliance with this policy.
Develops, operates, maintains, and sells assets in a cost-effective manner.
Processes daily banking and finance tasks using the organization's preferred banking and finance platform.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of banking and financial services, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Enables FinTech's and other third parties to connect with banks' systems via Application Programming Interface's (APIs) to build banking offerings on top of the providers' regulated infrastructure.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Develops personalized value analyses, based on how financial services integrate seamlessly with the client's lifestyles and devices.

Understands all local and international legislation governing the banking industry. Keeps abreast with any updates and amendments and ensures that policies and procedures are updated to ensure continued compliance by the bank.

Always acts in good faith and in the best interest of the organization and its clients. Exercises their power for a proper purpose, does not exceed their power, and maintains unfettered discretion. Always avoids conflict of interests.
Ensures the daily smooth running of services provided by the bank branch to its customers, including the stability of its banking system used.
Evaluates a business customer's application for a commercial loan against a set criterion. Communicates the outcome of this evaluation to the customer.

Improves the organization's Return-on-Equity (ROE) by shifting from an in-house service delivery model to a connected flow model that drives simplicity, agility, and customer centricity. Expands the capabilities of the organization with those of their partners ecosystem.

Understands and applies knowledge of capital markets, a type of financial market, where the in-person and digital buying and selling of financial instruments, such as equities (e.g., stocks) and debt securities (e.g., bonds), is facilitated.
Analyzes investment performance over a specific period to provide investors with insights into the effectiveness of their financial commitments.

Oversees a collection of investments in the form of securities, bonds, cash, shares, mutual funds, cryptocurrencies, etc., within a specific timeframe. Helps investors achieve their long-term financial goals with minimum risk and maximum return.
Evaluates an individual customer's application for a loan product against a set criterion. Communicates the outcome of this evaluation to the customer.
Provides the most beneficial credit deal execution to the customer given the prevailing market environment, through examining, tracking, and documenting when choosing how to route credit deals.
Uses the risk-reward ratio to compare the potential profit or return of an investment with the amount of risk that must be taken to earn the return.
Develops a unified payments interface (UPI) to allow bank customers to make mobile or online transfers instantly between two banks.
Considers the financial requirements of clients and provides sound financial advice.

Collects relevant information about new customers and evaluates their risk category. Vets the customer for creditworthiness and ensures they are not on any money laundering or counterterrorism financing watchlists.

Creates a process of registration for customers who open new accounts or apply for other services. Requests information from them, to know who they are. Ensures this process is as simple and smooth as possible.
Captures and stores insightful data arising from market activity in a usable manner. Integrates data with external data. Applies ever-evolving data science techniques to generate actionable insight.
Evaluates the merit of a proposed merger or acquisition deal by means of estimating Pro-forma net income, to establish Pro-forma earnings per share (EPS).

Follows an additional process to Customer Due Diligence (CDD) for high-risk or high-net-worth customers and large transactions. Gathers significant evidence and detailed information, and documents the process in detail to support the decision made.
Separates biological macromolecules (e.g., proteins or nucleic acids) according to their electrophoretic mobility.

Identifies and partners with suitable Financial Technology (FinTech) companies for them to provide marketing, administration, loan servicing, or other services, enabling the bank to offer tech-enabled banking products.
Implements strategies to limit the organization's exposure to foreign exchange fluctuations and to maximize the return on their foreign market operations.

Calculates the global return on tangible equity (ROTE) to determine the organization's efficiency. Generates profits from every unit of shareholders' tangible equity to establish how well the organization uses investment funds, to generate earnings growth.
Packages well-designed insurance solutions to protect clients against unforeseen events. Enhances investment efficiency and provides significant estate planning benefits.

Builds invisible banking platforms to allow consumers to interact with their personal digital assistant (e.g., Siri or Alexa) who proactively perform daily personal and financial tasks, informed by insights gathered from structured and unstructured data.
Extract, clean, and integrate network data from a variety of sources to develop and deliver personalized customer products.

Develops a know your customer (KYC) policy that incorporates the four key elements 1) customer acceptance policy 2) customer identification procedures 3) on-going due diligence and 4) risk management. Monitors compliance with this policy.
Uses location information to strengthen access control mechanisms by adding features for defining and enforcing location-based authorization.
Establishes the fairest value for both seller and buyer in a merger and acquisition transaction by means of a thorough valuation of the company and examination of the market.

Conceptualizes the organization's mobile and online banking platforms for day-to-day transactions of customers. Includes trending features (e.g., the ability to put temporary holds on cards, view recurring charges, or scanning a fingerprint to log into an account).
Implements a device-agnostic strategy that makes information accessible to all users, strives to make cross-channel interactions seamless, and simplifies the customer experience.
Manages all situations in which the bank opens its application programming interface's (APIs) to third parties and gives those players access to data or functionality.
Designs remote banking solutions that drive increased customer experience and distinguishes the bank from immediate competitors.
Buying and selling securities on behalf of an investment firm or clients, through effective management of capital, risk, and security analyses.
Advises high-net-worth individuals on their investments and manages their portfolios. Has a fiduciary duty always, to provide investment advice that is in the client's best interest.
Supports customers with their securities portfolios. Securities services include clearing and settlement, and processing dividends or tax claims.
Oversees the processing of all claims. Provides support to team processing claims. Ensures team complies with related policies and procedures.
Monitors changes in credit scores and credit reports. Flags these changes for the client so they remain informed of their credit status.
Designs simplified operating models that lead to better service, lower costs, and increased profitability by means of simplifying technology, processes, and back office operations.

Offers specialized bank treasury services and product offerings that include cross-border payments, risk mitigation, cash management services, and trade finance deals. Focuses on strengthening the liability side of the balance sheet of a bank, through facilitating core transactional requirements of clients within the financial system.

Conducts transaction monitoring and behavioral analyses through the effective use of business intelligence (BI) and data analytics to improve better decision-making, fraud prevention, consumerization, and compliance-related BI growth.

Assess the degree of risk of the insurer's business and strives to set fair borrowing rates for loans, establishes appropriate premiums, and creates a market for securities by accurately pricing investment risk.

Ensures the financial health of an organization by planning, organizing, directing, and controlling the financial activities and resources of the organization. Ensures compliance with all relevant legislation and regulations.

Calculates several different types of analyses, including discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis, comparable trading multiples, precedent transactions, and ratios such as vertical and horizontal analysis for investment purposes, i.e., issued share price, business selling price, company acquired worth or evaluating other investment opportunities.

Provides investment advisory services that combine other financial services to address the needs of affluent clients. Coordinates all the services needed to manage high-net-worth clients' money to plan for their own or their family's current and future needs.
Automates accounting processes that are time-consuming and repetitive (e.g., collecting and processing financial data).
Personalizes the institution's services, including savings, checking accounts, credit and debit cards, and loans.
Performs analysis on a company, government, municipality, individual, or any other debt-issuing entity, to measure the issuers' ability to meet its debt obligations.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Engages a group of knowledgeable representatives on how things happen in the environment in which the organization operates. Gathers feedback that in turn shapes product development strategies.
Introduces and manages digital health and wellness products and services as part of medical and life cover strategies or policies.
Devises strategies to incentivize customers who show a commitment to green energy (e.g., electric cars).

Understands all local and international legislation governing the insurance industry. Keeps abreast with updates and amendments and ensures that policies and procedures are updated to ensure continued compliance by the organization.

Keeps abreast with local and international trends, developments, and technologies in the insurance field. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Replaces a missing or defective gene with a normal one to correct a disorder.
Identifies and leverages the latest insurance technologies (InsureTech) to reduce costs, improve operational efficiency, and the customer experience.
Devises more flexible insurance coverage offerings to attract and keep customers who seek usage-based fees.
Uses monitoring devices in cars to measure various indicators (e.g., speed, location, accidents, etc.). Processes this information to help determine policy premiums.
Utilizes uncrewed drones to collect data, calculate risks before issuing a policy, aid in preventative maintenance, and assess damages after a loss.
Develops an all-round risk evaluation process by calculating maximum possible loss (MPL) and the normal loss expectancy (NLE) and including strategies for loss prevention.

Devises various banking solutions (e.g., credit, asset, cash management, and underwriting) to attract and keep corporate clients. Advises corporate clients on these banking solutions to help them meet their business objectives.
Devises a short and long-term strategy to manage and acquire the securities and assets of a client within their investment portfolio, to meet their financial goals.

Offers a variety of products to a client to finance their home or other real estate. Educates the client on the benefits and conditions of each of these options and helps them make a well-informed decision.
Identifies potential operational inefficiencies (e.g., people, processes, or systems) that could result in a financial or reputational loss and puts strategies in place to minimize these risks.

Advises high-net-worth individuals (HNWI) on the banking and financial solutions available to them to meet their objectives. Manages the relationship with assigned private banking clients to ensure that they are satisfied and retained.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Devises a risk management framework for the organization that covers risk identification, measurement, mitigation, reporting, and governance.
Provides support to customers in arrears. Structures and negotiates facilities with these customers.
Negotiates and structures a plan for customers on how to repay outstanding capital and, where applicable, the interest accrued under the regulated loan contract.

Manages the use of assets and cash flows to reduce the firm's risk of loss from not paying liabilities on time. Ensures that assets are available to pay debts as they are due and that the assets or earnings can be converted into cash.
Studies, understands, and applies knowledge of markets where people trade financial securities and derivatives at low transaction costs.

Handles the process of becoming affiliated with health insurance networks for inclusion in their provider panels. Manages this process to ensure health care providers can accept third party reimbursement.

Creates a name, symbol, or design that identifies and differentiates a company and its products or services. Ensures all communication is reflective of, and consistent with, the organization's brand identity.

Understands all local and international legislation governing the investment industry. Keeps abreast with updates and amendments and ensures that policies and procedures are updated to ensure continued compliance by the organization.

Manages contracts between two or more parties where the value is based on an agreed-upon underlying asset or set of assets which could include bonds, commodities, interest rates, currencies, market indexes and stocks.

Understands the concept and sources of liquidity risk. Monitors, measures, and manages liquidity risk to ensure the organization can meet payment obligations and support its operations during times of disruption in the market.
Changes the deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) of an organism that can lead to changes in physical traits (e.g., eye color and disease risk).

Understands the trading environment, which involves all the external forces that influence the organization as it deals with international and local markets. External forces include political, legal, economic, technological, and cultural environments.
Uses various techniques to grow small pieces of plant tissue (e.g., explants) under sterile conditions on a nutrient culture medium of known composition.
Submits a buy or sell trade order to the relevant market on behalf of an investor. Ensures that the buy or sell order gets executed.

Compiles economic data into a single metric or benchmark using statistical tools and techniques. Applies this benchmark to track economic data such as inflation, unemployment, gross domestic product (GDP) growth, productivity, and market returns.
Aims to sell off various assets for financial, political, or ethical reasons and is likely to increase the value of the parent company.
Applies life sciences, physical sciences, mathematics, and engineering principles to define and solve problems in biology, medicine, health care, and other fields.
Develops biological solutions to sustain, restore, and improve the quality of life for humans, plants, and animals.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Manipulates human cells and genomes, respectively, to create customized drugs.
Produces genetically similar molecules, cells, genes, microbes, plants, or organisms from a common parent by asexual reproduction in vitro or in vivo.
Preserves organelles, cells, tissues, or other biological constructs by cooling the samples to very low temperatures.
Combines the cytoplasmic genes of one species with the nuclear and cytoplasmic genes of another species.
Transfers deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) from one organism to another through bacteriophage.
Introduces one or more deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) sequence from another species by artificial means, to modify an organism.

Ionizes chemical species and sorts the ions based on their mass-to-charge ratio. Provides a rapid and sensitive qualitative and quantitative analysis of biomolecules, drugs, and small molecule compounds, and metabolites.
Grows and designs antibodies in a laboratory to restore, enhance, or mimic an immune system response.

Detects and analyses proteins based on their ability to bind to specific antibodies. Uses this information to prove different properties of proteins from a complex mixture of proteins extracted from cells based on molecular weight. Transfers proteins to a solid supporting membrane.
Researches and creates new biological parts, devices, and systems or redesigns systems already found in nature.
Provides online assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of patients.
Compiles electronic media that has both a sound and visual component.
Sets prices primarily based on a consumer's perceived value of a product or service.

Exploits enzymes, microorganisms, and plants to produce energy, industrial chemicals, and consumer goods. Focuses on developing biotechnological approaches that will yield green industrial processes that are cost-effective and sustainable.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

competency_name: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) Application
description: Understands science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) and the application thereof within the industry one is working in. Knows when and where to apply knowledge of the different areas and how to use it effectively.
Develops a biological or synthetic substance that can be introduced into body tissue as part of medical devices or to replace an organ or bodily function.
Produces complex biologic products from materials (e.g., living cells, matrices, biomaterials, and molecules) by reconstructing the structural and functional complexity thereof.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Applies moral rules and professional codes of conduct to the collection, analysis, reporting, and publication of information when conducting medical and biological research. Ensures active acceptance of research subjects' right to privacy, confidentiality, and informed consent.
Advises company representatives on what to say and how to say it when speaking with members of the media.

Advocates for a particular action, position, or set of principles that the organization feels strongly about, with the aim to create or change policies, laws, regulations, distribution of resources, or other decisions made by the government.
Forms relationships that relate to anything that affects or enhances the organization's reputation and strategic effectiveness.
Assists in the preparation of the organization's annual report. Substantiates and defends any findings in the report to investors.
Uses, records, and modifies audio content so that it is fit for purpose.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Uses renewable energy and carbon offsets to achieve carbon neutrality and adopts a "zero waste" approach to business.
Establishes and maintains a mutually beneficial relationship with the community in which the organization operates. Strives to contribute positively to this community.
Creates and edits content so that it is appealing and understandable or relatable to the intended audience.
Ensures that every business process considers the impact on stakeholders and the consequences for the business.

Tests messages across the various channels the organization uses to communicate and gauges the responses to these. Determines how effectively the organization's communications are connecting with its audiences and adjusts strategy, as necessary.

Develops a strategy that specifies how an organization communicates information with its employees, customers, suppliers, and investors. Ensures alignment to the goals of executives. Determines who the audiences are and the various channels the organization will use to reach these.
Develops a plan to address unfavorable press coverage or misinformation about the organization. Proactively protects the organization's image and reputation.
Applies moral considerations in a practical setting. Focuses on real-world actions and their moral concerns in public and private life, the professions, health, technology, law, and leadership.

Manages visual content, including page layout and design, in preparation for publication, using the most suited publishing software for the job. Uses this software to prepare and organize print magazines, newspapers, periodicals, and possibly also e-catalogs and online publications.
Uses online platforms to communicate information about the organization to employees, current and potential customers, and other stakeholders.
Translates creative ideas and assets into an array of digital media, to ensure that the right messages are delivered via the right channel at the right time to the right consumer.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Organizes news conferences, product launches, and interviews, and creates materials (e.g., banners, flyers, etc.) for such events.
Drafts emails and memos announcing company news and initiatives. Manages internal blogs, newsletters, or other publications. Pays careful attention to employee messaging.
Compiles employee resources (e.g., information about employee benefits). Ensures these resources are updated as and when any of the information changes.
Writes press materials and makes presentations to media representatives updating them on any useful information about the organization.
Monitors the news for mentions of the organization, it's product or service, and key members (e.g., stakeholders or leadership).
Communicates with the target audience using print media (e.g., magazines, newspapers, brochures, flyers, newsletters, etc.).
Engages stakeholders to explain organizational policies and views on public policy issues, assisting policy makers and legislators in amending or laying down better policy and legislation.

Conducts market and public opinion research related to the reputation and positioning of the organization within its country/ies of operation. Designs direct informational programs to foster favorable public perceptions.
Communicates with attorneys, government regulators, emergency responders, and politicians as necessary. Serves as trusted advisors and advocates, true partners and leaders of the organization.

Contributes to regulatory development by submitting proposals to the regulators (government) and the regulated (industry). Provides statistics and information on issues that could impact the organization's ability to operate successfully.

Understands securities and exchange commission (SEC) laws and securities disclosure requirements, as well as filing requirements. Keeps abreast with any updates and amendments and ensures that policies and procedures are updated to ensure continued compliance.
Provides greater transparency in how the organization operates and impacts the greater society outside of the business.
Creates a communication and collaboration hub for the organization that makes it easier to distribute information and get work done.
Develops investment strategies and portfolios that seek to consider both financial returns and social good.
Prepares text, content, or templates for the purpose of delivering speeches or conducting interviews.

Uses font style, appearance, and structure in copy to elicit certain emotions and convey a specific message. Arranges letters and text to make the copy legible, clear, and visually appealing to the reader.
Uses applications to design and build websites for either the Internet or Intranet.
Assesses how well content meets one's goals. Evaluates the effectiveness of text, images, audio, and video.
Volunteers in the community by participating in social, charitable, and environmental activities.
Acts as a neutral or impartial dispute resolution practitioner. Provides independent, impartial, confidential, and informal help to managers, employees, clients, or other stakeholders.

competency_name: International Ombuds Association (IOA) Standards of Practice and Code of Ethics
description: Understands and complies with the standards as set out. Stays informed about updates to these standards and how they affects one's role.

Uses an in-depth process to capture the employee's experiences, expectations, preferences, ideas, grievances, suggestions, and aversions. Presents a detailed set of employee wants and needs through either qualitative or quantitative research methods. Attempts to improve employee experience, workplace culture, boost productivity, and refine business processes.
Monitors behavior, activities, or information for information gathering, influencing, managing, and directing.
Conducts interviews to elicit evidence or information during an investigation. Attempts to produce the most accurate, complete, and detailed account of the incident in question.
Understands various investigative techniques to determine the truth of the matter. Decides on the best techniques to extract the information required.
Executes and manages payroll activities including information gathering and capturing, managing benefits and deductions, submitting the payroll run for approval, and the processing of payments.
Collects, analyzes, interprets, and shares information on mines and unexploded ordnance (UXO) threats and their impact, to assist the planning of mine action projects.

competency_name: Compensation and Benefits Policies and Procedures
description: Designs, reviews, and maintains compensation and benefits policies and procedures. Ensures that practice and policy is within all applicable legislation for the advancement of organizational goals.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the compensation and benefits field, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Serves as a member on the Compensation Committee to discuss and investigate matters of compensation and refer proposals to the board for approval.
Understands how the Linear Accelerator (LINAC) device customizes high-energy x-rays or electrons to conform to a tumor's shape and destroy cancer cells, while sparing surrounding normal tissue.
Plans and organizes the compensation, remuneration, salary review, and increase process.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Researches, administers, and maintains the organization's benefit programs (e.g., retirement plans, group health, leave policies, wellness programs, insurance policies, stock plans, etc.).
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Designs and manages employee rewards programs to improve employee morale and performance. Presents a complete package (financial and non-financial) of organization offers to employees.

Designs, contributes, and documents the compensation and benefits strategy that articulates the organization's approach to managing executive packages. Ensures these incentives motivate an executive to achieve goals, as set by the Board of Directors.
Combines external (e.g., industry and regionally specific data) and internal (e.g., salary grading system and analytics) sources to ensure pay competitiveness, fairness, or equity.
Manages or administers the organization's group health benefits plans. Educates others on the available benefits and liaises with health benefit providers.
Designs and maintains short-term, medium-term, and long-term employee incentive schemes or programs.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Designs, outsources, or administers the organization's life insurance policies and programs for employees. Educates others on the available benefits and liaises with health benefit providers.

Designs pay scales or pay structures based on internal and external equity using small, midpoint, and large job ranges. Conducts all compensation related calculations to construct a competitive pay scale. Revises pay scales annually and applies the inflation rate or other adjustments as needed to maintain current pay scales.
Audits the payroll process to ensure pay rates, deductions, and tax holdings are up-to-date, accurate, and legally compliant and that there are no irregularities (e.g., duplicate bank accounts etc.).
Processes daily payroll and benefits information using the organization's preferred payroll platform.

Provides various reports to assist the organization in controlling labor expenses, overhead costs, and profit margins. Completes and submits government required reports timely and accurately. Prepares payroll reports for accounting.

Calculates tax deductions from an employee's wages or salaries as well as the taxes required to be paid by the employer, based on the employee's wages or salaries. Ensures these calculations are correct and meet regulatory requirements.
Designs retirement or provident income and benefits programs. Monitors the performance of a pension or retirement fund. Ensures compliance within a regulatory environment.
Contributes information to media and digital sources for end-user/audiences in specific contexts. Creates material to contribute to the online world.
Draws on salary survey data to match internal job descriptions to external jobs with similar responsibilities to determine the market rate for each position.
Designs/contributes and documents the compensation and benefits strategy that articulates the organization's approach to managing employee compensation and benefits.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Understands different compensation and benefits methodologies, including salary benchmarking and modeling as well as best practice. Applies this appropriately within the area of compensation and benefits.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Designs and manages military and veteran benefits programs. Presents a complete package (financial and non-financial) that the organization offers to these employees.
Promotes the company's products and services by promoting the brand. Develops strategies and plans to position and promote the brand and ultimately ensure brand equity.
Develops various marketing techniques as well as sales strategies to reach the widest possible customer base. Uses various ways or outlets to market and sell products.

Develops, uses, and provides secure access to all the tools and resources that employees need to work from anywhere, at any time, from any device. Provides the enterprise with the technology to communicate, collaborate, and drive productivity effectively.
Creates digital or remote workspaces to allow teams to collaborate from anywhere. Taps into the combined knowledge of workers in diverse locations without physically being together.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of corporate communications. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Builds an authentic community amongst the business' customers, employees, and partners through various types of interactions.
Manages and orchestrates all internal and external communications aimed at creating a favorable point of view among stakeholders on which the organization depends.
Focuses on engagement with customers in such a way that ensures the customer experience is improved.
Uses relevant desktop publishing tools to design and develop various organizational materials.
Uses electronic channels to communicate news and ideas in the corporate environment.
Transmits digital media through various digital platforms (e.g., social networks, email, messaging applications, and blogs).
Creates mobile software systems where staff can communicate and collaborate more effectively.

Establishes clear accountability for the organization's digital frameworks, strategies, policies and processes that ultimately enable employees and the organization to build and maintain a digital presence safely and effectively.
Seeks or gathers voluntary financial contributions by engaging individuals, businesses, charitable foundations, or governmental agencies. Considers fundraising platforms where relevant.

Researches financial grant opportunities suitable for the organization's needs. Develops and writes proposals in line with the requirements of the grant opportunity. Represents the organization and negotiates the details.

Creates a strategy that takes the marketing department from disparate functions to one interconnected approach. Utilizes various marketing collateral and channels and merges them with one dependable message.
Uses various media channels to communicate and manage news and ideas in the corporate environment.
Schedules and controls media production to ensure that quality deliverables and customer needs are met. Utilizes current media production processes and procedures.
Uses installed audio, visual, and animation software tools to produce multimedia publications. Understands various multimedia publishing technologies and procedures.
Deals with news and media situations in a manner that is likely to lead to a good outcome for the organization.
Writes official statements on behalf of the organization, to deliver to the news media for purposes of providing information, making an official statement, or making announcements.

Plans the movement of finished printed materials from a printing facility to an internal storage location, the customer, a distribution center, or the end-user. Sets the distribution of printed materials in motion.
Designs and builds files that print, fold, and trim correctly. Understands the physical process of printing as well as the finishing processes (e.g., folding and binding).
Checks written materials before publishing to identify discrepancies, mistakes, and other technical errors.
Reviews the final draft of a piece of writing to ensure consistency and accuracy in grammar, spelling, punctuation, and formatting.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Evaluates and applies different publishing methods and options. Recognizes key features (e.g., open source and proprietary options). Manages copyright, data protection, and other legal issues related to publishing and the re-use of published information and data.
Understands and utilizes the functions and features of different software products or product groups. Applies the software to generate internal and external communications.
Develops hypotheses, applies theory and research methods, analyzes the results, and evaluates and records the findings.

Identifies, analyzes, plans, and implements actions that influence stakeholders in a systematic manner. Identifies the need of key groups and plays a vital role in ensuring those business needs are met.

Provides and combines multiple enterprise communications channels (e.g., voice, video, personal, and team messaging, voicemail, and content sharing). Includes the control, management, and integration of these channels.

Develops and sets up video conferencing technologies that allow users in different locations to hold face-to-face meetings without moving to a single location. Uses this technology to hold routine meetings, negotiate business deals, and/or interview job candidates.
Manages daily operations of the call center, including forecasting, scheduling, employee training, reporting, and all customer interactions or escalations.
Writes and edits documents to ensure corporate messages are communicated throughout the organization.
Oversees grants and manages the grant's lifecycle, from pre-award research through to post-award grant closeout.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of Digital Media, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Examines language samples to determine phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics. Describes rules and processes to support translation or comprehension.
Conveys meaning from one language to another. Ensures correct use of grammar, tenses, and sentence construction.
Devises a stakeholder engagement strategy to ensure the organization has a sound plan for understanding, involving, and prioritizing stakeholders in its activities and decisions.
Provides administrative or operational services (e.g., classifications, submittal reviews, recommendations for payment, preparation of change orders, etc.), to navigate a construction project.
Manages a construction project's schedule, cost, quality, safety, scope, and function.

Creates a rough, physical drawing that provides a high-level overview of a project or development's basic features. Includes building cost estimates to determine if the concept aligns with the project budget.
Conducts a construction site inspection and completes a daily diary to record the progress and evaluation of a specific process or procedure.
Complies with the prescribed building codes and regulations for all construction activities.
Prepares, updates, and reviews construction drawings and specifications. Ensures that it meets the construction project standards.
Evaluates building and development performance to establish if design goals have been met. Improves the ongoing design principles.
Evaluates submissions for proposed developments and grants permission if they meet all minimum requirements and specifications.

Identifies and develops business opportunities and ensures the profitable management of projects and contracts. Maximizes potential business growth and profitability. Monitors and controls internal processes. Manages external relationships with subcontractors and clients.
Promotes company products and services and guides customers to making great brand choices.
Aligns the organization's goals and products to the values and needs of its customers.
Offers customers many ways to interact with the organization. Enables customers to switch between many channels and still experience the same quality of service.
Measures customer pain points to determine where the organization needs to speed up or simplify the experience.
Builds an emotional connection between the customer and the product/brand. Creates engaged customers who are likely to purchase more and demonstrate loyalty to the product/brand.

Identifies, interprets, understands, and uses the theory and development of computer systems that can perform tasks that normally need human intelligence. These include things such as visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and language translation.
Designs and delivers an exceptional customer experience. Considers the customer journey, brand touchpoints, and the environments the customer experiences.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Utilizes data obtained on customers through various platforms to better understand customers and build deeper relationships. Draws useful insights from data obtained which informs organizational direction, strategies of product offerings, and marketing channels to better serve customers' needs.

Maps a customer's interaction with the organization, from where the interaction begins to where a long-term relationship is formed. Captures precise information on how customers move through software and where they fall off. Helps improve the customer experience.
Understands how organization's customers are segmented and why. Aims to understand customer's behavior and preferences.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Utilizes customer relationship management (CRM) as a tool to leverage the full potential of the organization's channels. Builds a 360 degree customer view and improves operational efficiency.
Determines customer retention rates. Implements strategies and plans to increase customer retention rates.
Implements ways of measuring customers' satisfaction with the organization's products or services. Recommends the appropriate changes to improve customer satisfaction.

Listens and records customers' queries or demands while being courteous and attentive. Addresses customers' comments, questions, concerns, and objections with clear, direct, accurate, and timely responses.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Processes daily customer service tasks using the organization's preferred customer service platform.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide customer interactions, service levels, issue resolution, etc.
Creates a pleasant customer onboarding experience from when the new customer starts their journey as a customer of a Software as a Service (SaaS) product or service.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of customer support, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Brings order, structure, and needed resources to customer situations which could lead to customer dissatisfaction and/or reputational damage.
Provides support to customers via conversational agents capable of intelligent conversations with human users.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Explains product/service specifications, reliability, durability, pricing, warranties/guarantees, benefits, etc. Provides options for alternative products/services. Explains discounts, promotional offers, packages, and services.
Assists potential customers already browsing the organization's website by giving them the opportunity to chat in real-time 24/7. Solves customer queries in an instant by eliminating waiting times.

Provides a knowledge base to customers with information about the organization's products (e.g., documents, videos, and frequently asked questions (FAQs)), to help customers answer their own questions.
Encourages customers to share their personal products/services experiences with friends, thus creating social commentary to encourage promoting goods and services.
Delivers content to customers via videos (e.g., webinars, online meetings, and video email).
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Improves customer experience through a shared customer service philosophy and guiding principles upholding the core values of customer interaction.
Creates an environment for the efficient and effective operation of the support team and brings problems to a timely resolution.

competency_name: Business Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats (SWOT)
description: Compiles and analyzes a list of the business's greatest strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats. Uses this information to assess a changing environment and respond proactively, to further the company's strategy.
Researches, develops, and implements actions needed to communicate effectively with a customer after the completion of the sale.
Designs marketing approaches based on customer needs and interests. Prioritizes customers over other factors through the use of intuition, common sense, and data about customer behavior.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Views the customer experience as the absolute core of what the organization does. Understands that customer satisfaction brings meaning to the organization, forms the basis of both internal and external communication, and provides the driving force for action.
Uses systems in which a record of transactions made are maintained across a decentralized database using several computers in a peer-to-peer network.
Designs and uses sales approaches based on customer needs and interests. Prioritizes customers over other factors, through the use of intuition, common sense, and data about customer behavior.

Constructing websites, mobile applications, or software to [also] be accessible to someone who may have a disability that affects hearing, vision, motor functions, or cognition. The design also considers changing abilities due to ageing or illness as well.
Identifies and categorizes opinions that was expressed in a piece of text to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product and so forth is positive, negative or neutral.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Focuses on increasing the flow of business value from the customer's request to customer delivery. Follows a systematic approach to measure and improve flow, shorten time-to-market, increase throughput, improve quality, and optimize for business outcomes.

Uses an in-depth process to capture the customer's experiences, expectations, preferences, and aversions. Presents a detailed set of customer wants and needs through either qualitative or quantitative research methods.
Takes steps to help customers resolve issues before they occur by spotting or anticipating the problems and extending support to fix them.

Focuses on securing a maximum return on short-term investment for its shareholders and other financial entities that have infused capital into the company. Structures leadership and business departments to support sales teams and create promotional campaigns to stimulate consumer interest in company products. Focuses on gaining the highest possible profit in the shortest amount of time.
Interacts with projected future markets through selected customers by researching their wishes and attitudes, ideas and visions, perception of signals, and drivers of change.
Receives, accepts, and responds to inquiries from stakeholders with the requested information. Attends to queries on time.
Processes claims received, effectively and efficiently. Ensures all information to process the claims are received from the client. Keeps client updated on the progress of the claim.
Determines the profit an organization generates from a specific customer. Evaluates how beneficial it is to the organization to keep this customer.
Understands the processes and methods involved in ticket sales. Resolves customer inquiries, problems, and concerns.
Processes ticket sales via an online ticketing system. Creates a ticketing page with ticket categories, ticket prices, and payment options.
Creates, implements, and uses formal disciplines, practices, and standards for improving the effectiveness, efficiency, and safety of ticket sales processes and procedures.
Manages ticket and gate sales for activities and events. Consults with required stakeholders on promotional activities.
Builds an emotional connection between the guest and the event. Creates engaged customers who are likely to purchase more and demonstrate loyalty to the product or brand.
Implements ways of measuring guests' satisfaction with the organization's products or services. Recommends the appropriate changes to improve customer satisfaction.
Measures guests' pain points to determine where the organization needs to speed up or simplify the experience.
Determines retention rates. Implements strategies and plans to increase returning guests.
Aligns organization's goals and products to the values and needs of its customers.
Maximizes opportunities to enhance the success of customers through driving revenue, improving customer retention, or creating efficiencies.
Monitors the level of customers retained during a set period.

Honors and follows agency policies and procedures such as delivery processes, standard operating procedures (SOPs), timekeeping, and AMEX receipts, etc. Takes responsibility for client and agency financial stewardship, as applicable.

Supports global and local pharma and biotech medical affairs teams and their associated function. Meets and exceeds the expectations and requirements of clients. Ensures the organization has the appropriate composition of all the information and communications technology infrastructure and systems. Implements usage of software, hardware, firmware, networks, and company websites in an appropriate manner.

Combines multiple traditional and advanced disciplines to design, model, align, execute, monitor, and create better decision models and processes. Assists the organization to make better decisions through these models.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of student support, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.

Learns to be open and honest about oneself, one's capabilities and the learning process. Learns who one is as an academic including what type of approaches, styles, ways of thinking, and working one is developing.

Identifies opportunities for collaboration with local employers. Forms and manages partnerships/strategic relationships that support the possible placement of students. Develops networks and builds alliances.

Designs, develops, and modifies components and systems of all types of flight vehicles.

Processes daily finance and accounting information using the organization's preferred finance and accounting platform.
Maintains accurate and complete financial records. Provides access to these records during any auditing process.

Uses math, physics, and chemistry as tools to explore, understand, and control how materials work. Applies the knowledge gained to design new materials, identify optimal existing materials, advises processing techniques, and explains why materials fail.
Applies knowledge of statics, dynamics, strength of materials and fluid dynamics to solve mechanical problems.

Studies different forms of measurement and establishes a common understanding of units. Defines units of measurement, realizes these units of measurement in practice and ensures traceability through linking measurements made in practice to the reference standards.

Designs ergonomic spaces and products that lessens the risk of injuries, enhances physical comfort and safety in use. Adjust budget to accommodate customers or employees working in different spaces or using products in different manners.

Uses a procedure to support, disprove, or validate a hypothesis. Provides insight into cause-and-effect by demonstrating what outcome occurs when a specific element is manipulated.

Oversees facility utility processes to ensure that it is completed in the safest, most time- and cost-efficient way. Designs tools, machines, and systems with the aim to design safe, comfortable, and effective human use. Takes human capabilities, limitations, and characteristics into account.

competency_name: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) Knowledge
description: Understands science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM), and the application thereof within the energy industry.
Designs, implements, and optimizes biochemical processes to create new products and processes. Uses knowledge of engineering, biology, and chemistry in this process.

Monitors energy usage and researches ways to use it in a more efficient manner, or for ways to reduce the amount of energy required to produce products and provide services. Considers the effects of pollution due to energy usage and how to reduce it.

Designs, implements, and optimizes processes and infrastructure for the supply of water, disposal of waste, and protecting people from the effects of negative environmental happenings, such as pollution.
Identifies, measures, and communicates economic information to the management of the organization, to enable them to make informed decisions.
Ensures the accurate and timely processing of invoices according to payment schedules. Compiles associated reporting.
Ensures the accurate and timely processing of positive pay transactions. Compiles associated reporting.
Advises the organization on whether to buy or sell other businesses. Conducts the financial analysis and due diligence to support recommendations.
Forms part of the internal team responsible for working with an auditor. Includes processing, providing information, and assisting with all matters.

Advises accurate and actionable audit findings and recommendations for implementation, to address and correct issues. Documents the findings and actions for implementation, to cut or end future occurrences.
Manages tasks, projects, or requirements to a specified business budget. Authorizes expenses within this budget to achieve operational goals.
Develops and manages annual and multi-year budgets that are adequate for the organization's needs.

Manages the accounts payable and receivable to manage business cash flows. Prepares and maintains cash flow analysis as needed. Performs detailed modeling of the organization's future financial liquidity over a specific timeframe.
Collects, disburses, and invests the cash of an organization while maintaining the organization's liquidity.
Fosters a closer working relationship with accounting clients by enabling them to work collaboratively on the same data, from anywhere in the world.
Reviews constraints within a production line or sales process, to determine bottlenecks and calculate the impact of these constraints on revenue, profit, and cash flow.
Evaluates, manages, and expedites sources of funding, the capital structuring of the organization, and investment decisions.
Identifies the company's spend, earnings, and losses. Reports and analyzes the company's cost structure.
Prepares the valuing/costing of assets, liabilities, income, and expenses in conformity with relevant accounting policy and regulations. Requires a high level of judgment/complexity.
Calculates the reduction of the monetary value of a fixed asset in a systematic manner, until the value of the asset becomes zero.
Appraises and calculates the value or cost of something to the organization, when the exact figures are not known.

competency_name: Finance and Accounting Policies and Procedures
description: Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide finance and accounting practices.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of finance and accounting, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Reads, interprets, and draws accurate conclusions from financial and numerical material.
Provides regular one-on-one client sessions to guide clients toward making financial performance improvements, that meet the individualized goals set mutually between the client and counselor.
Analyzes financial information to forecast business, industry, or economic conditions to inform investment and/or business decisions.

Prepares operating performance projections and key metrics analyses to support reporting, planning, and forecasting activities. Considers the organization's historical performance and makes assumptions about the future.
Delivers accurate and timely financial reports. Includes month-end, quarterly and year-end close, and statutory reports.
Calculates and manages risks through the application of mathematical-statistical models. Manages risks to achieve business goals.
Prepares, reviews, and analyzes financial statements to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Ensures the business is compliant across the Group, in various jurisdictions, with local and international regulations.

Calculates inventory turnover to make quality decisions on pricing, manufacturing, marketing, and or purchasing new inventory. Identifies the carrying cost of inventory for the company and highlights the excessive amounts of inventory to improve process efficiencies.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Creates and issues invoices to debtors of the organization. Compiles associated reporting.
Translates transactions denominated in foreign currencies into the currency of the organization's primary operations. Analyzes and minimizes the risk due to currency fluctuations.
Analyzes the financial obligations incurred in the day-to-day operations of the organization. Recommends ways to reduce this, to improve gross profit margins.
Calculates organization's total cost of production. Analyzes factors that could change organizational costs to decrease product/service costs. Maintains specified cost and profitability goals.
Records the initial appearance of the crime scene and physical evidence to collate a permanent record.
Determines the total costs involved in the production of goods or services, through cost accounting principles.
Compares the organization's financial records against monthly statements from external sources (e.g., banks) to make sure they match up. Detects errors, discrepancies, or fraud.
Adheres to laws, regulations, guidelines, and specifications relevant to its business processes.
Actions a refund to a customer for a product that is returned.
Monitors potential risks to the organization on a continuous basis. Alerts the organization of emerging risks that could impact the organization's ability to conduct business.
Analyzes data from application systems or databases to identify and analyze patterns of fraudulent activities.
Analyzes analytes (e.g. drugs, metabolites, and biomarkers) in biological samples as part of drug discovery and development initiatives.
Analyzes and recommends changes in how the organization structures its finances and payroll, to minimize its tax obligation within the framework of legislation.
Complies with all relevant tax laws and regulations. Completes and submits tax returns and payments for the organization in a timely fashion and accurately.
Ensures the business is compliant locally with all relevant tax matters.
Ensures that the organization always has enough cash available to meet its business operations and obligations.

Maintains the record-keeping system for the organization's financial data, with debit and credit account records. Ensures the general ledger provides a record of each financial transaction that takes place during the life of an operating company.
Identifies, measures, analyzes, interprets, and communicates financial information to management to assist the organization in making well-informed business decisions.
Verifies the accuracy and appropriateness of the financial model/s used in financial projects/forecasts.
