Analyzes biological samples to identify species in biological material.
Oversees the management of trusts and funding which includes income collecting, tax reporting, disbursement processing, asset movements, statements, record keeping, and customer service.
Studies proteins, peptides, deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), and drug molecules through separation, detection, identification, and quantification of biological samples.
Designs, reviews, and maintains policies and procedures to govern, identify and solve financial crimes. Ensures that practices and policies are within all applicable legislation.
Prevents, detects, and monitors financial crime risks within the organization. Addresses suspected financial crime activities through investigations.
Reduces costs while improving business value by making more informed spending decisions and investing in growth and digitalization.
Examines a sample of blood to obtain information about its physical and chemical properties.
Inspects a property's condition before a tenant takes occupation and after the tenant leaves, and creates a detailed inspection report.

Uses power equipment, such as lawnmowers and leaf blowers, to perform landscaping tasks and maintain the facility's grounds. Collects and empties trash. Applies fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides. Performs routine maintenance on equipment. Sets up, adjusts, repairs, and cleans irrigation systems.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Follows a standardized procedure, to enable a compound of interest to be identified and quantified in a biological matrix/matrices through setup, optimization, and pre-validation.
Studies life and living organisms. Researches the structure, function, growth, distribution, evolution, or other features of living organisms.
Analyzes body fluids, stains, and other bodily materials to establish the origin of the material.

Investigates violent, suspicious, or unexpected deaths or deaths that were unattended by a physician.
Uses various techniques that enable the separation, identification, and purification of the components of a mixture, to measure the relevant proportions of the mixture.
Conducts tests in a clinical laboratory in order to get information about samples of blood, urine, or other tissues or substances. Helps diagnose a disease or other conditions.
Practices adequate courtroom etiquette to present a clear, honest, and objective testimony. Gives evidence in a composed manner.

Profiles criminal behavior, crime scenes, and victims from the known behaviors and emotions suggested by other criminals, crime scenes, and/or victims. Analyses a specific criminal, crime scene(s), and victim(s) exclusively from forensic evidence relating to the crime scene(s) and victim(s) of that offender.
Analyzes the bullet and its impact to establish if the information found can be used in a court of law.
Uses deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) profiling in criminal investigations to compare criminal suspects' profiles to DNA evidence to determine potential involvement in the crime.
Obtains high-resolution images of biological and non-biological samples to investigate detailed structures of tissues, cells, organelles, and molecular complexes.
Addresses questions related to release histories and sources of contamination in the environment, through the application of defensible scientific methods.
Analyzes evidence related to a criminal trial to learn more about it.
Conducts a skeletal analysis and gathers information from remains to determine who died, how they died, and how long ago they died.
Utilizes various methods to photograph, collect, and examine evidence at the crime scene, preserving each specimen separately.
Examines and analyzes all forensic information related to physical evidence to draw conclusions and produce a report.
Follows evidence packaging and preservation protocol to minimize deterioration and contamination.
Presents evidence in court through oral testimony.

Compares fingerprints collected at the scene of the crime with those of suspects, to provide evidence of the presence of a particular person at a particular place. Compares the general shape of the fingerprints, the shape and depth of the ridges in the print, and the length of each ridge.
Investigates and analyzes financial information and data to determine the likeliness of financial reporting misconduct.
Provides accurate, timely, and thorough information/data to all types of decision-makers in the criminal justice system.

Conducts classic microbiology techniques (e.g., cultures and biochemical identification). Incorporates molecular biology assays, genetics, and phylogenetics to establish the cause of death and the identification of people.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide forensic practices.

Applies scientific methods and techniques to matters under investigation by a court of law.Uses electron microscopes, lasers, ultraviolet and infrared light, advanced chemical techniques, and computerized databanks to explore the evidence.
Calculates the probability that an individual will commit a violent or anti-social act.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of forensics, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Develops skills and responsibility around recognizing, assessing and minimizing risks, and preparing for emergencies in the laboratory.
Separates compounds or metal complexes in two different immiscible liquids, usually water (polar) and an organic solvent (non-polar).
Maintains a missing persons database of all persons reported as missing by law enforcement.

Uses an extractive technique by which compounds are dissolved or suspended in a liquid mixture and are separated from other compounds in the mixture, according to their physical and chemical properties.
Follows standardized scientific processes and procedures to conduct experiments to explore observations and answer questions.
Provides a statement made under oath.
Clones small samples of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) to create a big enough DNA sample for testing.
Uncovers the physical evidence at a crime scene to aid in the process of establishing the series of events that led to the crime.
Applies archaeological methods during the investigation of a crime scene, to identify evidence and reconstruct the crime scene for further analyses.
Recreates the face of an unknown individual from their skeletal remains through an amalgamation of artistry, anthropology, osteology, and anatomy.
Applies a highly sensitive blood reagent to detect latent bloodstain evidence, usually associated with a clean-up subsequent to a bloodletting event.
Follows the proper chain-of-custody procedures to ensure the admissibility of the results of evidence in court.
Collects urine samples under the indirect supervision of participants in drug testing programs. Screens the urine samples and documents results.

Understands all local and international legislation governing the business. Keeps abreast with any updates and amendments and ensures that policies and procedures are updated to ensure continued compliance.

Identifies direct or indirect competitors. Analyzes their product/service offerings, unique value propositions, pricing models, marketing strategies, etc. Distinguishes the organization's offerings and ensures competitiveness.
Manages the contracting process including planning, risk assessment, management, negotiating contract terms, ongoing oversight, and review.
Develops and applies formulation strategies early in the drug development process in order to avoid costly late-stage failures.
Studies how different drugs act on the human body and how their healing effect can be safely used. Studies the formulation, development, and manufacture of new drugs.
Measures company performance of products, services, or processes against those of other businesses considered to be best in the industry. Identifies opportunities for improvement.
Analyzes business decisions by weighing the investment cost up against the anticipated benefit that will be derived from making the investment.
Gathers, stores, accesses, and uses information collected via quantitative (e.g., surveys or usage data) or qualitative methods (e.g., interviews, focus groups, document analysis).

Develops dashboards to display aggregated information in a way that is both intuitive and visual. Provides insights to foster business growth and improvement by tracking all relevant key performance indicators (KPIs).
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Collects and synthesizes information to enable strategic decision-making. Uses a variety of data analysis tools, techniques, and methodologies.
Studies genes and explains what they are and how they work.
Uses varied tools, techniques, and processes for gathering and reporting data. Knows which data to collect and what would be useful to report on.
Ensures high data quality exists throughout the complete data lifecycle. The key focus areas include availability, usability, consistency, data integrity, and data security.
Retrieves, transforms, or classifies information via a computer.
Develops standardized quality assurance methods and test cases. Ensures data is high quality and fit for the intended use (e.g., for operations, decision-making, and planning).
Creates and implements computing systems that capture, store, process, and analyze data near the source, where the data is generated. Improves response times and saves bandwidth.
Ensures that data policies and standards turn into practice within the employee's domain.

Examines an organization or business unit's workflows to improve operational efficiency. Identifies areas of process improvement (e.g., redundant tasks or processes, inefficient workplace layouts, and bottlenecks) in the workflow.
Complies with the regulations for data security. Ensures personal data is gathered legally and under strict conditions. Protects the data against accidental loss, destruction, or damage.
Takes a source of data and gains a better understanding of what this data means.
Predicts future outcomes by analyzing patterns that are likely to forecast future results. Uses mathematical and statistical processes.
Determines the best prices for products and services being offered by developing various models and weighing the advantages and disadvantages of each.
Focuses on the maintenance of a desired level of quality in a service or product, with attention to every stage of the process of delivery or production.

Develops original statistical and econometric models in pricing, assortment, direct marketing, marketing mix models, risk management or for other business analysis purposes (e.g., using SAS, SPSS, or R software).
Prepares reports, letters, articles, ideas, projects, documents, stories, or educational aids using language, structure and approach that is fit for purpose.
Uses actual data to make business decisions.
Knows how to use a personal computer, how to type, and has general web searching skills.
Scopes out deliverables, team resources, timelines, and the methods that will be used to deliver the work in the engagement sessions. Gains agreement from all parties on the proposed engagement plan.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Coordinates the consulting practice's planning, design, and implementation of work. Creates a focused work environment. Guides and coordinates the activities of the consulting personnel to achieve business goals. Adjusts activities to improve and maintain efficiency, effectiveness, and productivity.
Utilizes applicable processes and their tools to effectively conduct and conclude the consulting process.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Acts according to a set of guidelines to make decisions in an ethical manner in consulting. Behaves in a socially acceptable and professional manner and shows integrity.

Develops and delivers marketing documents/proposals to clients. Includes the problem statement, approach to follow, deliverables, experience, and skills of the person that will work on the project, as well as cost.
Virtualizes cloud environments that are used in computing using Virtual Machine ware (VMware).
Measures internal products, services, and practices to determine the quality of the work performed and if it could be improved with current resources.
Develops diagrams to examine why something has happened or might happen. Divides potential causes into smaller categories.
Processes daily human resources tasks using the organization's preferred human resources platform.

Uses relevant presentation software to develop a presentation. Conveys important information to an audience within and outside of the organization. Ensures presentation is aligned with corporate identity.

Uses the relevant spread-sheeting software to convey important data/information to an audience within or outside of the organization. Organizes data logically and ensures that all formulae are correct. Uses Excel or other appropriate tools.
Uses the relevant word processing software to create, edit, save, and print documents. Ensures that the latest corporate template is used.

Conducts a systemized, procedural analysis of key performance indicators that can illustrate a business' current reality, opportunities, and gaps. Assesses the benefits, risk factors, and possible success of identified opportunities.
Establishes differences in the genetic complement by comparing a deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) sequence to that of another sample or a reference sequence.
Plans, organizes, and supervises the production, manufacturing, or provision of services. Focuses on delivery and ensures that an organization successfully turns inputs into outputs.
Collects data and uncovers patterns and trends. Uses this information to test hypotheses or provide an approximation for something that is difficult or impossible to measure.
Uses statistical analysis systems (SAS), to obtain multivariate analysis and predictive analytics through data mining.
Ensures an organization stays competitive by executing the business strategy consistently and reliably. Focuses on lowering operational risks, running costs, and increasing revenues.

Assists with the daily running of the business. Assists with clerical and administrative processes such as organizing meetings, making travel arrangements, responding to inquiries, and implementing procedures and systems.
Applies and uses knowledge from different functional departments to address problems.
Enhances organizational efficiency through the optimization of some specified processes, steps, or parameters. Aims to minimize costs and maximize output.
Creates websites including webpage layout, content production, and graphic design.
Recognizes, evaluates, and records the key requirements of a business problem that needs to be resolved or a business objective that needs to be met.
Creates, updates, and maintains text, graphics, and links in a website using Extensible HyperText Markup Language (XHTML).

Creates, documents, and oversees the workflow for tasks and/or activities required to complete a particular business process or project. Ensures that tasks and/or activities are completed accurately, consistently, and efficiently.

Works with professional service, customer success, customer support, and customer experience teams to support and improve the team's capacity as well as help them scale. Balances the needs of internal stakeholders and external customers with the use of technology, to keep a positive customer experience.
Asserts control over an uncertain world by identifying assumptions about the future and determining how the organization will respond.

Manages the gathering and submitting to a third party for checking and verifying the authenticity of various information types (e.g., business, personal, and/or confidential). Checks for truthfulness and transparency.

Provides technical support to help internal or external customers implement solutions and solve problems. Communicates effectively with customers, listens to problem descriptions, analyzes problems, responds effectively, and provides constructive feedback to the client on problem resolution.
Manages, monitors, and stores enterprise-wide data. Uses a set of processes and practices to ensure data accuracy, availability, security, and good governance across an enterprise.
Utilizes an operating system to allocate system resources to various tasks. Aims to ensure that all jobs are carried out on time by prioritizing specific job queues.
Uses software and processes to maximize the performance of data storage resources.
Utilizes computer science and statistics to transform raw data into knowledge.
Applies a set of processes and tools to evaluate performance against key indicators.
Uses non-traditional methodologies and techniques for the treatment and prevention of disease. Treats patients by making use of alternative medicine.

Redefines the organization's strategic position and draws up a long-term plan and orientation for the company. Creates, reviews, and includes descriptions of markets, target groups, customer benefits, partner relationships, key processes, cost structures, and revenue streams in the business model.

Maintains, implements, and utilizes the instruments and regulations that are needed to uniformly design and develop the process management of the organization. Develops standards for how process management should be developed and used.

Develops ways to help the business adapt quickly and respond to disruptions while maintaining continuous business operations and ensuring the safety of people and assets. Identifies essential functions and prioritizes critical actions that must be taken in times of massive disruption.
Applies a systematic approach to problem-solving that entails tracing the source of the issue, applying a solution, and testing to ensure efficacy.
Considers resource trends, facts, and changing demands to make predictions regarding future capacity needs.

Provides care on an outpatient basis, including diagnosis, observation, consultation, treatment, intervention, and rehabilitation services. It can include advanced medical technology and procedures even when provided outside of a hospital.
Uses augmented reality applications to deliver more realistic training to students.
Provides nursing care to cardiac patients. Applies cardiac care principles and procedures to ensure the health, well-being, and safety of patients.
Studies the construction of specific chemical compounds to enhance desired characteristics.

Collaborates with the team (inter-professional if applicable), person, and family to ensure care plans are consistent with goals of care, preferences, and advanced care plans (ACPs), which may change throughout the life-limiting condition(s).
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Assesses a patient's condition. Discusses relevant treatment options with the medical team to ensure the most timely, safe, and cost-effective care. Aims to reduce a patient's length of stay and health care costs.
Utilizes applications to support clinical diagnosis and treatment. Uses and manages clinical applications in a clinical practice.
Collects and interprets relevant information about the health and function of patients to engage patients in creating a plan of care that includes essential and optimal services and supports.
Designs, plans, and physically manages clinical trials for the organization. Includes medical monitoring, product safety, clinical monitoring, and project management for each specific clinical trial.

Uses channels or tubing to conduct a reaction in a continuous stream rather than using a flask. Provides chemists with unique control over reaction parameters to enhance reactivity or enables new reactions.

Implements international ethical and scientific quality standards for the design, conduct, performance, monitoring, auditing, recording, analyses, and reporting of clinical trials. Protects the rights, integrity, and confidentiality of trial subjects.
Conducts testing under controlled scientific conditions in a laboratory or similar setting.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Identifies any untoward medical occurrences that may result in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
Combines different chemical substances to produce a medical compound or medical drug.

Adheres to generic good practice (GxP) guidelines and regulations to ensure that bio/pharmaceutical products are safe, meet their intended use, and adhere to quality processes during manufacturing, control, storage, and distribution.
Creates formulation prototypes by developing, testing, and then reworking the formulation as necessary until an acceptable formula is achieved, from which a drug can be developed.
Develops and optimizes the production process for chemical compounds and scales up laboratory reactions.

competency_name: Clinical Trial Operations: Good Clinical Practice (GCPs)
description: Ensures study management and good clinical practice (GCP) compliance, safety management (e.g., adverse event identification and reporting, post-market surveillance, and pharmacovigilance), and handling of the investigational product.
Follows a molecular biology procedure to measure the activity of a drug or biochemical in an organism or organic sample.
Studies cell structure and cell function to gain deeper insights into the tissues and organisms of which cells are composed.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Conducts lab experiments under highly controlled conditions to ensure accurate measures, following a standardized procedure.
Relies on biomedical research for the improvement of the health of patients and society. Focuses on disease management through new therapies.
Applies emergency care principles and procedures to ensure safety and proper care of acute illnesses or injuries.
Observes the movement of a drug into, through, and out of the body. Focuses on the duration of its absorption, bio-availability, distribution, metabolism, and excretion.

Automates everyday tasks and processes performed in a pharmacy or other healthcare setting. Mechanizes processes which could include medication dispensing, packaging, labeling, storage, and retrieval of medications.
Understands, integrates, and implements principles of clinical pharmacology that underly the individualization of patient therapy and contemporary drug development.
Studies new tests and treatments and evaluates their effects on human health outcomes.
Generates research subjects or ideas and then tests these hypotheses to conclude whether it is true or false or whether the relationship between the variables is significant or not.

Collects, integrates, and validates clinical data. Encompasses all aspects of processing clinical data. Works with a range of computer applications and database systems to support the collection, cleaning, and managing of subject or trial data.

Integrates PK (pharmacokinetic) and PD (pharmacodynamic) models into one set of mathematical expressions to provide answers on the efficacy and safety of new drugs, faster and at a lower cost. Assists in a more efficient drug development process.
Applies the laws of physics to the study of biological phenomena.
Creates games through concept generation, design, building, testing, and release. Describes the design, development, and release of a game.
Generates proteins through biotechnological processes.
Studies how changes in the molecular structure of biological macromolecules affect their function.
Studies and analyses the distribution patterns and determinants of health and disease conditions in defined populations.
Extracts several independent parameters that contribute to the observed value of a function. Executes experimental tests or procedures in which multiple parameters are monitored simultaneously.
Uses chemistry, biology, pharmacology, and other biological sciences to discover, design, develop, and synthesize pharmaceutical drugs.
Identifies and develops small molecule drugs that can enter cells easily, as it has a low molecular weight.

Incorporates the uniqueness of each person, family, and community into different aspects of care. Builds relationships by listening without judgment and being open to learning from others. Advocates for culturally safe practices that are free of racism and discrimination.
Uses nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy to analyze the molecular structure of materials by observing and measuring the interaction of nuclear spins when placed in a magnetic field.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Studies chemical structures and processes of biological phenomena that involve the basic units of life and molecules. Studies deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), ribonucleic acid (RNA), and macromolecules that are essential to life processes.
Applies experience from previous studies with similar diseases, devices, or drugs.
Demonstrates awareness of common audio, video, graphic, mapping, and animation software.
Evaluates new drug applications against certain criteria. Provides feedback on the outcome of the evaluations.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Evaluates the integrity of data submitted to authorities. Conducts a review of documents, facilities, records, and any other resources related to the clinical trial and site of the trial.

Standardizes and applies a validated database management system that deals explicitly with and manages all aspects of a clinical trial, including study planning, preparation, performance, and reporting.
Manages data requirements and how it is acquired during clinical trials. This includes source data, data entry, queries, quality control and correction, and the concept of a locked database.

Develops and implements process plans to collect and evaluate the relevant data on devices. Determines if there is enough evidence to show that a device conforms to the necessary regulatory requirements, is safe, and performs to expectations or whether a clinical investigation is required.

Designs and writes protocols that describe the objectives, design, methodology, statistical considerations, and organization of a clinical trial and ensures the safety of the trial subjects and the integrity of collected data.
Uses a Geographic Information System (GIS) that analyzes and displays geographically referenced information.

Manages the supply of materials required for conducting clinical trials. Arranges and manages 24-hour collection and delivery of biological specimens, investigational drugs, kits, other study materials, and supplies. Assists with permit applications where necessary.
Conducts investigations to prevent accidents or adverse effects. Gathers and analyses information to decide the cause and make safety recommendations.
Seeks to understand the end result of the structure and processes of the health care system, on the health and well-being of patients and populations.

Designs, implements, and utilizes software systems to manage clinical trials in clinical research, including tracking deadlines and milestones. Uses these systems to support and manage the planning, performing, reporting, and participant information.

Compiles an annual report on the safety data collected during clinical trials. Develops the safety profile of drugs that contribute to its benefit-risk assessment. Collects, verifies, and presents adverse event/reaction reports that arise from clinical trials.

Conducts further studies after a compound has initially shown potential and passed early safety testing. Focuses on detecting signals that a drug is active and looks for preliminary evidence of efficacy in a clinically relevant endpoint.

Studies and assesses the potential impact of a substance or hazard on a person's health, a group of people, or the community. Interprets factual and technical information to understand the potential effects of the substance or hazard.
Provides access to accurate information and services with regard to contraception and sexually transmitted diseases. Offers access to prenatal, birthing, and postnatal care.

Applies the methods, tools, and technologies used in the decontamination process for exposure to hazardous chemicals or germs. Conducts decontamination of hazardous chemicals or germs in various medical environments.
Analyzes and synthesizes data and other information (e.g., clinical codes, terminologies) to support existing solutions and develop new solutions.
Studies how informatics and information technology can be used to deliver healthcare services. Applies this information to improve the delivery of these services.
Develops systems that use real-time medical data to generate insights, make decisions, increase revenues, save costs, and reduce errors.
Assesses and diagnoses patient's oral health and possible concerns to engage. Creates a plan of care that includes essential and optimal services and supports.
Applies mandatory regulations that govern the production and use of medical devices.
Diagnoses, treats, and prevents diseases of the teeth, gums, and related mouth structures. Repairs or replaces defective teeth where required.
Oversees day-to-day practices of a healthcare facility ensure satisfactory client experiences.
Studies and analyzes blood, blood-forming organs, and blood diseases in order to treat blood disorders and malignancies, including types of hemophilia, leukemia, lymphoma, and sickle-cell anemia.
Produces images of internal body structures for clinical purposes or medical science. Understands imaging techniques, processes, and procedures used in diagnostic imaging.

Studies and analyzes cellular, functional, behavioral, evolutionary, computational, molecular, cellular, and medical aspects of the nervous system and how the neurosystem impacts behavior and cognitive functions.
Works with dental implants. Implements an artificial tooth root into the patient's jaw to hold a prosthetic tooth or bridge.
Studies the human mind and its functions, specifically those affecting behavior in a given context. Tries to understand the mental characteristics or attitude of a person or a group.

Coordinates efforts to advance and track patients from prospect to enrolled patient and beyond. Interacts strategically with various stakeholders in additionally managing study financial aid, registration, orientation, and patient well-being.
Understands and incorporates federal, state, and local enrollment laws and processes. Complies with relevant laws and regulations for patient enrollment practices and activities.
Provides counseling services to patients. Gives patients a safe place to talk about problems and concerns, guides patients toward solutions or provides more insight and understanding.

Provides care to patients through the diagnosis of sickness and the provision of treatment to facilitate recovery and/or manage the illness. Provides ongoing support to maintain physical and emotional well-being.

Supports patients and guides them through the healthcare system. Assists during screenings, diagnosis, treatment, and follow-ups. Supports patients by communicating with healthcare providers and ensuring the patients get the information required to make informed decisions.

Applies knowledge of Medical Technology (MediTech) to monitor patients and measure certain bodily functions, record stats, observe patients, and set up applicable machines. Displays knowledge of and uses MediTech that will work best for each specific patient and illness.

Applies the Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) technique in daily activities to encourage continuous improvement in activities that are related to community needs and improved population health. Continuously asks the questions "How are we doing?" and "Can we do it better?".
Uses disease management practices and interventions for specific populations with specific conditions. Improves the health status of patients and prevents or minimizes the effects of disease.
Understands health counseling concepts and methods. Encourages, motivates, and guides individuals and family members in improving their health and learning about disease prevention.
Considers the care of patients, the protection of subjects, and safety in the conduct of a clinical trial.

Studies and treats diseases that affect only a small percentage of a population. Determines if the disease can be classified as rare based on the number of people living with the disease and/or the existence of adequate treatments within a particular population.
Studies and treats disorders of the heart and the cardiovascular system.
Disinfects inanimate objects using liquid chemicals or wet pasteurization. This is done to eliminate many or all pathogenic microorganisms, except bacterial spores.

Provides quality drug safety information in oral or written form to internal or external stakeholders (e.g., regulatory agencies, health care professionals/providers, drug consumers, etc). Knows how to counsel others on drug safety.
Uses electronic systems to accurately enter information into patient records and access them when required.

Assesses clients and designs exercise programs to enhance physical fitness and promote health by reducing the risk of developing chronic disease. Ensures safety during exercise sessions. Understands exercise prescription and programming.

Uses toxicology and other disciplines (e.g., analytical chemistry, pharmacology, and clinical chemistry) to aid medical or legal investigation of death, poisoning, and drug use. Conducts such studies to ensure the ability to use findings as part of legal investigations.
Studies, diagnoses, treats, and/or cares for individuals with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH), a rare and serious condition characterized by high blood pressure in the arteries of the lungs.

Transmits and receives electronic health care data in a standardized format among trading partners. Understands health care electronic data interchange (EDI) technologies, standards, implementation guidelines, and technology alternatives.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Translates verbal and written descriptions of diseases, injuries, and medical procedures into standard diagnosis and procedure codes, in related practices. Applies knowledge of applicable standards, rules, and regulations that govern medical information coding.

Applies knowledge of the full spectrum of activities for facilities planning, operations, and maintenance. Develops and maintains the physical environment of the health care facility to ensure it is conducive to patient care delivery.
Applies health care industry knowledge appropriately to diverse situations. Understands the industry's trends, directions, major issues, regulatory considerations, and trendsetters.
Understands health care and major issues concerning the industry. Complies with health care operating principles, government regulations, and codes of ethics in health care related situations.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the health care field, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Complies with health care laws and regulations in health care practices and activities. Knows federal, state, and health care-related laws and regulations.

Understands philosophies, approaches, processes, and practices which are required to deliver health care services. Implements, designs, assesses, and improves health care service models and ensures they align with organizational goals.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Studies the problems faced in promoting health for all. Aims to understand the behavior of individuals, health care providers, public and private organizations, and governments in decision-making. Applies economic theories of consumer, producer, and social choice.
Performs effectively on interprofessional teams.

competency_name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
description: Adheres to and applies the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) in daily tasks. Ensures patient health care coverage and protects private information.
Explains the various organizational structures of health care delivery, funding mechanisms, and the way that health care services are delivered.
Designs and implements health-medical programs for an organization's employees through the application of knowledge of these plans, associated processes, issues, and considerations.

Manages and impedes the spread of infection and disease through applying knowledge of different types of infections. Uses appropriate methods, tools, and techniques in the prevention and control of infections and diseases.
Gathers information, analyzes it, and creates an action using devices with automated systems, that are connected over the Internet to help someone track and prevent disease.

competency_name: Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO)
description: Uses standards and guidelines of the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO) to provide a safe and efficient care environment.
Knows the uses of the various laboratory equipment available and can operate and calibrate these. Identifies and addresses malfunctions. Adheres to safety and operating procedures.
Provides scientific and clinical support for commercial products. Serves as the medical face of a pharmaceutical company and relays clinical knowledge to health care professionals and stakeholders.
Receives, processes, stores, and supervises prescriptions. Authorizes transfer and refills prescriptions. Ensures delivery of accurate, secure, and efficient medical services.

Complies with health care operating principles, government regulations, and codes of ethics in health care-related situations. Provides health care in a manner that is consistent with national, state, and health care laws to meet the individual needs of patients.

competency_name: Medicines and Device Development and Regulation
description: Applies an understanding of how drugs, devices, and biologicals are developed and regulated.
Investigates the growth, structure, development, and other characteristics of microscopic organisms (e.g., bacteria, algae, or fungi).
Describes key elements of palliative care and displays a palliative approach. Identifies people who would benefit from a palliative approach.

Reduces preventable errors through the basics (e.g., hand hygiene, reporting errors, and using patient safety checklists). Practices self-care and reaches out when feeling overwhelmed since clinician well-being plays a crucial role in patient safety.
Demonstrates mastery of general principles of professionalism, communication, and respect for patients and recognizes optimal health and quality of life from the patient's perspective.

Uses data to create a personalized experience for each patient-customer. Creates a trusted environment that prioritizes respect and strong, open communication. Nurtures an environment that consistently meets excellence standards across a wide variety of performance areas.
Takes responsibility for a patient's drug-related needs and is accountable for this commitment. Focuses on achieving definite outcomes to improve the patient's quality of life.
Discovers, formulates, and manufactures drugs. Designs new drug manufacturing facilities and optimizes manufacturing processes.
Architects, designs, builds, administers, and maintains Linux servers in a cloud environment.
Applies microbiology practices in pharmaceutical and health care environments. Studies microorganisms associated with the manufacturing of pharmaceuticals and maintains contamination control.
Studies the biochemical and physiologic effects of drugs on animals, humans, microorganisms, or a combination of organisms.
Compares the value of one pharmaceutical drug or drug therapy to another. Evaluates the cost and effects of a pharmaceutical product.

Studies the uses and effects of drugs in well-defined populations. Aims to provide an estimate of the probability of beneficial effects of a drug in a population and the probability of adverse effects.
Studies the effect of genetic makeup or genes on how people respond differently to drug therapy.
Studies the role of the genome in drug responses. Analyzes how the genetic makeup of an individual affects the response to drugs.

Researches the physical, chemical, biochemical, and biological properties of drugs, drug substances, or potential drugs or drug substances of natural origin. Searches for new drugs from natural sources.
Studies drugs, their sources, nature, and properties. Evaluates how the body responds to drugs.

Uses mathematical models of biology, pharmacology, disease and physiology to describe and quantify interactions between xenobiotics and patients. Considers both beneficial effects and adverse effects.
Provides therapy using pharmaceutical drugs.
Monitors the effects of medical drugs after they have been licensed for use, specifically to identify and evaluate previously unreported adverse effects.

Applies epidemiological, bio-statistical, and evidence-based methods to improve health systems' performance at population level. Uses vital statistics and core health indicators to guide decision-making and analyze the health trends of a population, to guide the provision of health services.
Considers an individual's genes, environment, and lifestyle to identify personalized disease treatments and prevention strategies.

Tests ideas for new medicines, devices, or bio-medical prevention strategies in laboratory experiments or in animals. It encompasses everything that happens before a candidate is considered for human testing.
Offers routine health care services that may include screenings, check-ups, and patient counseling to prevent illnesses, disease, or other health problems.
Describes the array of key provider organizations and health professions and their implications for the quality and cost of care of individuals and populations.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Assesses and diagnoses the patient's psychosocial well-being using different tools and techniques. Explores and analyzes the reasons behind symptoms and generates resolutions according to the available treatment options.

Establishes goals and objectives for improving health outcomes. Incorporates an understanding of the social determinants of health and the socioeconomic environment in which the organization functions.
Uses medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases.
Provides content required at the site level to run a study. This may include financial and personnel aspects. Considers both the site and study operations.

Applies moral rules and professional codes of conduct to the collection, analysis reporting, and publication of information about research subjects. Ensures active acceptance of subjects' right to privacy, confidentiality, and informed consent.
Understands scientific concepts that relate to the design and analysis of clinical trials.
Uses technology to connect and automate processes in health care, to reduce pressure, increase comfort and efficiency, and decrease risks.
Supplies speech-language therapy. Designs individualized rehabilitative programs for clients who have communication and swallowing disorders.
Uses physical or chemical methods to destroy or eliminate all forms of microbial life in healthcare facilities.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Provides surgical assistance and perioperative care to patients. Complies with applicable health and safety standards.
Builds agility into the design and culture of the organization which enables agile teams to form quickly based on the knowledge, skills, and experience required.

Demonstrates an awareness of and responsiveness to the larger system of health care to provide patient care that balances quality and cost, while maintaining the privacy of the individual patient. Systems-based practice encompasses the societal, organizational, and economic environments in which health care is delivered.
Engages and collaborates with team members within and outside their own discipline. Provides high-quality, interprofessional team-based health care to people with disabilities.
Measures and analyzes potential toxins, intoxicating or banned substances, and prescription medications present in a person's body.
Organizes a medical function to meet the medical needs of patients in restoring or maintaining their health.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the medical field, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Reviews the prescribing, dispensing, administering, and ingesting of medication to ensure the desired outcome for patients.

Communicates medical and scientific data and information on innovations and perspectives on diseases and their treatments to different audiences (e.g., doctors, nurses, pharmacists, hospital staff, and even patients). Conveys a consistent, clear, and compelling message to support the pharma company and its product throughout the brand lifecycle.
Creates, implements, and enforces guidelines, ethics, ideas, or procedures, that have been proven to produce optimal results and are established or proposed as a standard suitable for adoption.
Develops marketing and sales strategies to educate the market on a pharmaceutical product and to boost its sales.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the pharmaceutical sciences field, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Uses medical billing/billing models and or processes to submit, follow up, or appeal claims to get payments for services rendered (e.g., testing, treatments, and procedures).

Studies chemical reactions that take place inside organisms. Combines elements from both biology and chemistry. Studies molecules like proteins, lipids, and carbohydrates which are important in metabolism and other cellular activities, as well as enzymes and deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA).

Collates data on a biopharma product's effects. Provides results to the relevant regulatory authorities for review. Gains approval for the use of the product, if its benefits outweigh its known and potential risks for the intended population.
Researches the physical, chemical, biochemical, and biological properties of drugs, drug substances, or potential drugs or drug substances. Searches for new drug sources.
Conducts performance reviews by gathering anonymous input from subordinates, co-workers, and managers. Incorporates all this feedback into a person's performance review.
Applies principles and methods for curriculum/training design to deliver teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, along with the measurement of training effects.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Attracts and recruits highly skilled workers with specialist skills when it is needed, from inside or outside of the organization. Fills specialized talent gaps for the short to medium term with these knowledge workers. Educates and empowers employees to view change positively and to behave in ways that facilitate effective change when necessary.
Implements working arrangements that allow more flexibility to employees in terms of when, how, and where they work for the organization.
Uses an application tracking system effectively to collect and sort through all applications.
Develops highly immersive learning experiences to help learners acquire new knowledge, especially through e-learning simulations. Eliminates the need for extended hands-on practice.
Uses biometric technologies to analyze and measure personal characteristics, both behavioral and physiological, for effective people management.
Influences candidates' feelings, behaviors, and attitudes they experience during the recruitment process, by having well-defined sourcing, recruiting, interviewing, hiring, and onboarding process.

Teaches others how to do something using various strategies, techniques & tools. Imparts job specific knowledge, skills, and abilities. Improves the performance of individuals, groups and the organization.
Passes information on to others that will be taking on a trainer role. Enables them to become effective trainers.
Uses videos to teach knowledge or skills. Controls content selection (internally developed or externally available) in line with the training curriculum.

Ensures that the workplace and facilities are accessible to all people with disabilities. Provides employees with disabilities with the appropriate equipment to be able to perform their duties comfortably and competently.
Provides hands-on, job-specific instruction to an intern/trainee to help them gain an understanding and become proficient at the skill.
Ensures a diverse workplace and leverages the effects of diversity to achieve a competitive business advantage.
Creates workplace security awareness by teaching others about the need for the protection of physical and especially informational assets of the organization.

Provides employees with alternatives to on-site work. Enables employees to perform their work effectively and productively from a different location. Provides employees with the necessary technology, systems, and processes.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Optimizes the marketability of candidates by offering advice related to their job-search journey and interview process, to ensure they capture the attention of hiring employers. Enables candidates to get contacted and hired while on the recruitment portal.
Oversees, builds, maintains, and sustains relationships with job seekers. Attempts to improve recruitment outcomes and, enhance the employer brand through doing so.

Reviews a candidate's suitability for a position through various steps and types of interviews and assessments. Considers each candidate's qualification, experience, abilities, attributes, and fit to make an informed and accurate decision.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Develops and offers training and development opportunities that are focused on specific capabilities or skills.
Manages human resources (HR) activities (e.g., hiring, onboarding, training, termination, and legal compliance) of the organization's employees on a global scale.
Designs the entire development process from the inception of the idea through quality control, implementation, and assessment of the effort.

Refers to instructional theories and models to design and develop content and learning experiences, to encourage the acquisition of new skills and knowledge. Conducts a needs assessment to determine the learning needs of the target audience.
Implements learning and development related processes, tasks, and projects to ensure that operations run smoothly.
Implements HR-related processes, tasks, and projects to ensure that operations run smoothly.

competency_name: Learning and Development Policies and Procedures
description: Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide learning and development practices.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Identifies learning and development solutions and opportunities for development that falls outside of the organization's current curriculum.

Develops and offers a defined set of components or training programs to members of the organization. Issues a certificate to prove that they achieved a certain level of knowledge in this subject area.

competency_name: High-Potential Employee (HiPo) Talent Assessment and Management
description: Assesses and manages individuals with the ability, ambition, and commitment to succeed in more senior and critical positions.
Manages and improves relationships with current and potential future top candidates.
Calculates the number of employees who have left the organization for any reason, including resignation, termination, death, or retirement.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Measures the extent employees are happy with their jobs and it's role in their lives. Implements plans and programs to improve job satisfaction for employees.
Takes responsibility for counting and managing the number of people employed by the business.
Measures the organization or individual's ability to use resources. Develops solutions to improve this, if required.

Listens and records employees' queries or demands while being courteous and attentive. Addresses employees' comments, questions, concerns, and objections with clear, direct, accurate, and timely responses.

Acquires, allocates, and manages the resources (e.g., individuals, finances, technology, materials, machinery, and natural resources) required for a project. Ensures the effective use of resources on time and within budget.
Assigns and schedules the correct people and resources to work on necessary tasks to complete a project. Allocates in the most effective and economical way possible.
Investigates different resources to discover underused or inefficiently used resources and adjusts them to the organization's advantage.
Plans and predicts the future resource requirements of projects before they start. Considers the project's scope, possible constraints, unforeseen costs, and potential risks.
Designs workplaces that promote social distancing, physical comfort, and safety at the workplace. Adjusts the budget to accommodate employees working from home office spaces.
Studies all small living organisms not visible to the naked eye. Focuses on bacteria, archaea, viruses, fungi, prions, protozoa, and algae, collectively known as "microbes".

Reviews job applications. Searches for potential matches between the organization's requirements and candidates' qualifications and experience. Decides which applications to put forward for the interview process.
Offers programs (e.g., childcare arrangements, flexible working for home-schooling parents, organized biweekly family events, etc.) to support the well-being of an employee and their families.
Educates employees through workshops or personal financial planning sessions, to focus on new financial goals, budget planning, debt reduction, and saving tactics.
Offers opportunities to enhance personal mental wellness through speaking to a professional therapist, wellness applications for fitness and self-care, and mental health coaching.
Receives and distributes all incoming mail. Collects and mails all outgoing mail. Keeps record of all incoming and outgoing mail so it can be traced.

competency_name: Mental Health Diversity Equity and Inclusion (DEI)
description: Designs mental health diversity equity and inclusion (DEI) policies and programs, to support employees facing mental health challenges.

Offers a range of health coaching, on-demand fitness classes, and self-care subscription services best suited to individual interests and needs, such as Elevate for personal brain training, Power Napp App for insomnia and / or WellSpace and Wellable for health education.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide human resources practices.
Minimizes employee stress levels by reviewing workload, having regular check-ins (including discussing work-life stressors), and celebrating all small victories.
Offers chair massages, meditation pods, exercise days, comedy events, increased vacation and personal day allowances to help employees ease the stress.
Delivers health care, health education, virtual health appointments, and health information services through remote technologies.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Assists the organization to be more adaptive, creative, and resilient when dealing with complexity, uncertainty, and change that could affect their employee's well-being.
Uses a combination of recruitment strategies and channels to source candidates for the organization.
Understands how to identify the signs of workplace anxiety. Reaches out to colleagues who may need support, to help minimize the effects of workplace anxiety.
Designs, implements, and manages the procedures that control employee leave applications, approval, and tracking, within an organization.
Manages and maintains the Leave Management System to store, process, retrieve, and analyze information concerned with the administrative side of employees' leave.
Remains relevant and up-to-date with leave Management Policies and processes to design, develop, and manage leave to reduce risk to employers and employees.
Manages and implements the process of granting an employee a leave of absence due to a substantial limitation in one or more areas of life activity, as a result of a physical or mental impairment.
Provides outsourced HR services for clients. These can include payroll processing, recruitment, and so forth.
Processes claims related to disability leave. Provides support to the team processing claims. Ensures team complies with related policies and procedures.
Educates customers with the information, materials, and resources they need to enhance their success, use, and engagement with the product.
Oversees and manages the process of debt collection, including involuntary deductions (e.g., state and federal tax levies, bankruptcy orders, student loans, wage assignments, etc.).

Applies a set of data analysis tools and metrics for comprehensive workforce performance measurement and improvement. Uses both employee and return on investment (ROI) data to inform decisions on recruitment, retention, and employee management.
Plans and develops an organization's HR operations to increase individual and organizational effectiveness.
Designs a talent management strategy and supporting policy. Ensures the organization has a sound plan, methods, and guiding principles for achieving goals.
Manages the company stock option, equity, and compensation plans, and any other equity-related agreements to inform employees and oversee the associated procedures.
Finds and hires candidates by working closely with other departments. Involves a multistage interview process, allowing candidates to meet multiple employees, thereby improving the quality of hires.
Coordinates equity compensation benefits for employees. Understands legal, tax, and business contractual implications for both the employer and employee.
Controls the time an employee must work for an employer (vesting period) to own employee stock options or equity as part of the compensation packages offered.
Guides, motivates, and empowers individuals through setting, achieving, and maintaining health-related and wellness goals.
Assesses knowledge, skills, and behaviors by any applicable means, whether formal or informal, against the relevant competency frameworks.

Identifies and creates visibility of the skills available in the organization and skills needed for the future. Creates an organizational terminology and leverages digital platforms to ensure transparency of skills. Enables a culture of skills transferability across the organization.
Provides resources and/or opportunities to an audience or a group of people for them to progress and succeed in achieving a common goal.
Manages, creates, hosts, and tracks digital learning content on a platform and provides professionals with access to their content and to collaborate in a centralized location.
Studies human behavior through the application of psychological insights to explain economic decision-making.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Encourages employees to put forward colleagues or friends they know will be a good match for the organization. Develops and educates employees on the reward/s available if their referral is successful, to encourage them to participate and refer good candidates.
Builds and/or maintains a strong organizational culture by connecting an organization's purpose, beliefs, and core values to all people-related systems.
Transforms employee data into actionable insights that align talent management strategies to organizational goals.
Offers continuing education opportunities (e.g., formal or informal) for employees to improve their skills and boost business outcomes.

Understands and incorporates Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) best practices throughout the employee lifecycle, from attracting talent all the way through to succession planning. Ensures that all employees can thrive personally and professionally.
Uses content authoring tools to create engaging and interactive courses. Chooses the correct tool that saves production time and costs and modernizes the digital learning experience.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops learning programs that follow a curriculum design and systematically upskill the employees within various roles / functions / levels of the organization. The curriculum framework defines what learners should know and be able to do after each component. Formulates objectives, skills, capabilities and/or standards.

Measures the effectiveness of the organization's diversity and inclusion (D&I) strategy and policy, by segmenting the organization in several ways to ensure it is representative at all levels and functions. Uses the results of these metrics to improve the D&I strategy and policy.
Makes learning programs accessible and responsive across various devices. Provides learners with a seamless and flexible learning experience on any device at any time.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Handles, prepares, and stores food in a way that best reduces the risk of individuals becoming sick from foodborne illnesses.

Designs, manages, or implements employee aid programs (EAPs) to assist employees in resolving personal problems that may impact their performance at work (e.g., marital, financial, or emotional problems, family issues, or substance or alcohol abuse). Educates employees on the various options available to them.

Engages in two-way communication with employees about business matters (including but not limited to the scope of HR). Actively seeks and considers the views/concerns of employees before making critical business decisions.

Issues new employees with employment contracts. Updates new employment contract terms as per changes in legislation and regulations on employment. Interprets the contract during discussions with future employees before they sign an agreement.
Provides counseling services to employees. Gives employees a safe place to talk about problems and guides them towards solutions or teaches them ways of dealing with the problems.
Creates, implements, and uses formal disciplines, practices, and standards for improving the effectiveness, efficiency, and safety of human resources (HR) processes and procedures.
Draws up plans to help individuals improve skills for current roles and to acquire skills and knowledge for potential new roles and responsibilities in an organization.
Collects high-quality specimens of adequate volume and stores it appropriately before laboratory testing.

Develops strategies, solutions, and thought leadership to drive employee engagement across an organization and build a high-performing environment. Influences the extent to which employees feel motivated and passionate about their work and are emotionally committed and invested in the organization.

Devises strategies to optimize the employees' entire journey with the organization, from onboarding all the way to termination. Influences employees' perceptions about their journey of employment at the organization by continuously getting feedback and adjusting strategies as needed to improve the experience.
Designs and maintains the organization's employee handbook to support the organizational socialization of employees.
Studies viruses and virus-like agents, including their taxonomy, disease-producing properties, cultivation, and genetics.

Encourages employees to live healthier lifestyles. Educates employees on the various initiatives available to help them live healthier lifestyles. Determines and communicates various incentives to employees for participating in initiatives.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Creates programs for employee development, management training, competitive pay and benefits, rewards, and recognition, etc., to retain employees.

Creates and maintains the organization's employer brand - its reputation and popularity as a place to work and its employee value proposition. Entices candidates to consider employment with the organization by educating candidates about who the organization is, its mission and vision, work culture, and unparallel benefits.

Acts as an employee change agent and influencer. Provides strategies, solutions, training, tools, resources, and thought leadership to drive employee engagement across an organization, to build a high-performing environment.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Ensures the organization treats everyone fairly during employment decisions (e.g., hiring, promotion, termination, development, compensation, etc.). Avoids any form of discrimination of race, age, sex, religion, national origin, and physical or mental disability.
Uses games to deliver specific learning outcomes. Creates "real-life" situations that engage the employee in a fun way and maximizes their learning experience.
Adapts to generational changes in the workforce and shapes a modern business culture. Works with team members across the four generations - boomers, genX, millennials, and genZ.

Uses the employee's location tracked via their cell phone to send push notifications of bite-sized job-related training to an employee. Gives the employee vital information required to get their job done when they enter a specific perimeter.
Integrates the business strategy with people management practices.

Combines the utilization of freelance, flexible, and on-demand workers, rather than the traditional nine-to-five, to fulfill a project/task for the organization. Remunerates these workers based on work performed ('gigs').

Manages the administration of international assignees. Translates applicable policies, taxation, immigration laws, local legislation, and internal control procedures, in the delivery of programs focused on the seamless movement of talent.
Uses Ruby to build simple and productive websites. Analyzes data to prototype and proof concepts.
Identifies and builds relationships with appropriate schools, colleges, and universities to attract and hire their graduates.
Applies the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) to implement agile practices at enterprise scale.

Identifies, interprets, understands, and uses the theory and development of human resources (HR) computer systems that can perform tasks that normally require human intelligence (e.g., visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and language translation).
Evaluates the current human resources (HR) strategies to determine the effectiveness and future HR requirements of the organization.
Shows an understanding of the legal requirements related to the day-to-day management of employees and reducing legal risks. Ensures regulatory compliance.
Creates the steps necessary to implement the objectives that enable the organization to achieve its strategic goals. Implements these steps once they are agreed on.

Designs and administers HR-related surveys to identify problems/risks within the workplace, gauge satisfaction levels, organizational culture, engagement opportunities, or request manager feedback. Decides on the frequency of these surveys. Devises plans to address concerns raised via these surveys.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of employee relations, locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Evaluates, analyzes, designs, implements, configures, and maintains global HR Systems e.g., Workday or WebExit.

competency_name: Health, Safety, Security and Environment (HSSE) Policies and Procedures
description: Applies health, safety, security, and environment (HSSE) processes and procedures making health, safety, security, and the environment a vital part of the business.
Advises management on human resources policies and procedures. Enables management to make better employee-related decisions.

Proactively and continuously attracts candidates to apply for employment. Creates and builds relationships with potential candidates over a long period of time. Uses different digital marketing strategies to engage passive and active job seekers.

Provides opportunities for movement between roles within the organization. Educates employees of these opportunities and how to apply or be considered for them. Encourages employees to inquire about positions they are interested in, even if it is a complete change of career path.
Conducts detailed examinations and evaluations of a job, to determine the necessary information regarding the nature of the job.
Determines the value or worth of a job in relation to other jobs in the organization.

Establishing the key links between the essential requirements of a role, position, or job and highlighting the knowledge, skills, abilities, and behavioral characteristics necessary for successful performance.

Awareness of inherent advantages/disadvantages received by a person based on their race or socio-economic status. Educates management on being fair when giving opportunities for development, promotion, etc.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Understands all local and international legislations governing the day-to-day management of employees. Keeps abreast with any updates and amendments and ensures that policies and procedures are updated to ensure continued compliance.

Develops policies and procedures that guide workforce issues (e.g., grievances, disciplinaries, unionization, dispute resolution, etc.). Educates employees on these policies and procedures. Advises management on these procedures when issues arise.

Keeps abreast with the latest developments & learning theories (locally and internationally) and implements these in the organization as relevant. Ensures learning programs become more sophisticated in method with the emergence of new technologies.
Uses learner analytics to measure if training programs are effective and efficient. Uses data to further the development of the curriculum.

Drives a culture of learning to maximize employee potential, attract talented employees, and extend the length of stay within an organization. Ensures the investment into learning programs achieves the outcomes as expected.

Designs global learning (including eLearning) solutions by applying adult learning principles and innovative strategies using up-to-date technologies and methods. Selects and uses training/instructional methods relevant to the situation when teaching others new things. Adapts as the situation requires.

Manages the aggregation of content from multiple sources and providers to create more offerings for employees than the standard Learning Management System (LMS). Provides personalized and intuitive learning experiences to employees.

Manages the learning management system (LMS) for an organization, to execute the learning and development strategy. The content includes business rules, compliance, and a catalog of courses approved by management.
Implements learning material in small bits that are objectives driven (e.g., videos, small games, quizzes, and infographics).
Conducts a series of tests to test and validate the end-to-end system specifications. Strives to validate the complete and fully integrated software product.
Assists new employees to acquire the necessary knowledge, skills, and behaviors to enable them to be productive.
Facilitates the organizational change and development process through completion. Gains leadership involvement and line ownership.
Effects change in an organization using applicable techniques. Manages the transition from the current to the desired state of the organization.
Assists organizations with implementing planned and intentional interventions that are aligned with organizational goals to improve the organization's performance.
Studying people processes, functions, challenges, and opportunities at work, to elevate these systems and achieve sustainable business success.
Works with the organization's performance management system and offers support to managers, in setting up and completing performance appraisals.
Schedules and organizes training sessions, prepares training material, tracks attendance, and collates training feedback and evaluations.
Maintains personal information on the Human Resources Information System (HRIS) to promote data integrity of employee personal data.
Recruits talent on a project basis to meet a short-term talent need.
Connects with learners using their preferred social media channel to personalize the learning experience.

Supports the human resources (HR) team in their recruitment efforts. Assists with the advertisement of jobs, organizing interviews, communicating with applicants/candidates throughout the process, and record keeping.
Uses traditional marketing methods to attract and source job candidates. Educates potential candidates about the organization and sparks their interest in considering employment.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Formulates a plan to help streamline hiring processes and to ensure that the organization has access to the talent they need when they need it. Strategically plans hiring efforts to align organizational goals and skills gaps. Includes skills gaps analysis, recruitment calendar, tools needed, budget, and the selection process.
Measures and monitors the skills of people to develop workforce capability and aligns it with the organizational objectives.
Collaborates with other employees through forums, informal chat sessions, sharing sessions, and learning circles to transfer skills among one another.
Uses social media channels for recruiting candidates. Uses various platforms (e.g., Facebook, LinkedIn, blogs, forums, and job boards) to attract quality candidates.
Conducts interviews like exit interviews with top talent. Predicts termination risks and timeously addresses concerns raised, to avoid them exiting the organization.
Identifies current and future human resources (HR) needs to achieve organizational goals. Links HR management with the organizational strategic plan.
Identifies and develops potential new leaders to replace current leaders as they leave. Increases the availability of experienced and capable employees to assume these roles in the future.
Recruits, trains, manages, develops, and retains the best people to ensure business sustainability.

Uses a database to keep all candidates' details. Includes previous applicants, sourced candidates, and referrals. Accesses this pool when opportunities arise to pick the best suitable candidates to engage.
Implements digital time and attendance systems, interprets system analytics, and provides valuable information on employee attendance, personal/paid time off, and scheduling.
Works with and negotiates in good faith with union representatives. Complies with legislation governing employee representation.

Determines the gaps in an employee's skills-set to better understand an employee's developmental needs. Chooses the best solution to bridge this gap, to ensure the employee can do their job effectively and efficiently.

Designs the workplace with the capabilities and limitations of the human body in mind. Allows for improved employee performance and productivity by removing risk factors that lead to musculoskeletal injuries.

Devises a plan of response in the case of a workplace emergency, whether a fire or a heart attack. Ensures the organization has a fully stocked first aid kit, an automated external defibrillator, and that trained personnel are always available to use these.
Develops an emergency evacuation plan and educates staff on evacuation procedures, policies, and routes. Runs evacuation drills and implements changes to improve the success of evacuations.
Understands and complies with local fire codes. Performs regular assessments of potential fire hazards in the workplace. Trains certain employees in fire suppression equipment.
Develops and implements techniques and equipment for planting, growing, and harvesting food products for consumption.
Adheres to regulatory requirements when handling, storing, and transporting hazardous materials.

competency_name: Occupational Safety and Health Standards (OSHS) Compliance
description: Provides a safe working environment for all employees. Identifies issues that can result in health/safety risks. Ensures that all employees are trained on these health/safety standards to avoid accidents and incidents.

Applies the 5S checklist (sort, straighten, sanitize, standardize, and sustain) to help eliminate waste in the workplace. Standardizes the housekeeping system to ensure an organized, safe, clean, and efficient environment.

Promotes the use of smart electronic devices (electronic device with micro-controllers) that are worn on the surface of the skin, to detect, analyze, and transmit information about body signals (e.g., vital signs, and/or ambient data).
Promotes the use of the best wellbeing apps to promote a healthier lifestyle by tracking food intake, water intake and workout pattern.

Grows and maintains cells outside their natural environment under controlled conditions, to study the normal physiology and biochemistry of cells, the effects of drugs and toxic compounds on the cells, and mutagenesis and carcinogenesis.
Studies the science that deals with the composition, structure, and properties of substances and the transformations that they undergo.
Uses multiplex technology to measure changes in expression levels, detect single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), genotype, or resequencing mutant genomes.
Determines and measures the amount or dosage of radiation absorbed by a substance or living organism by means of a dosimeter.
Studies the subtle toxic effects that pollution exerts on living organisms by investigating the fate and effects of chemicals and natural substances on ecosystems.
