Studies micro-organisms (e.g., viruses, bacteria, and parasites) that cause intestinal illness and result in enteric diseases, which are usually food-borne.
Ensures conformance to environmental laws, regulations, standards, and other requirements (e.g., site permits to operate).
Identifies and evaluates environmental sources and hazardous agents to prevent human injury and illness and promote well-being.
Implements practical initiatives for environmental protection, health, and safety within the organization.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Follows the necessary processes to ensure equipment is reliable and in working order.
Studies the chemistry behind the biochemical nature of food, its properties, and how it is processed in the body. Studies chemical components (e.g., protein, carbohydrates, and so forth).
Investigates where and when food contamination occurred. Identifies the type of contaminant and its source. Identifies foreign taints, odours, and their source. Verifies what ingredients are in food.
Applies Fourier-Transform Infrared (FTIR) techniques to obtain an infrared spectrum of absorption, emission, and photoconductivity of solid, liquid, and gas.
Studies the entire genome and deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), including the sequence in an organism and draws conclusions from the results.
Implements principles to assure the quality and integrity of non-clinical laboratory studies intended to support research or marketing permits, for products regulated by government agencies.
Uses High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) techniques to separate, identify, and quantify components in a mixture.

Develops systems and methods to expedite the exchange of laboratory data via electronic data exchange. Designs systems and standards to support the acquisition, retrieval, and communication of test results and other laboratory data.

Develops, implements, and maintains the software system that is used in the laboratory for the integration of all laboratory software, instruments, and the management of samples, laboratory users, standards, and other laboratory functions. Supports information gathering, decision making, calculation, review, and release into the workplace.

Utilizes deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) sequencing technologies that are capable of processing multiple DNA sequences in parallel, to determine a portion of the nucleotide sequence of an individual's genome.
Applies genomic technologies to understand populations of organisms. Understands how genes contribute to our health and well-being in humans.
Studies natural and artificial radioactive elements and their use in the study of chemical processes.
Performs chemical and physical tests on raw materials and finished products to ensure the products meet established quality specifications.
Examines the quantity and sequences of Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) in a sample using next-generation sequencing. Analyzes the transcriptome of gene expression patterns that are encoded within our RNA.
Determines the order of amino acids in a protein.
Collects epidemiological and other data of relevance from health systems, populations, media, and other informal sources. Conducts surveillance and collects data in a well-defined and systematic way.

Interprets, analyzes, processes, and generates useful products that assist individuals such as public health practitioners, clinicians, responders, decision and policy makers, and wider stakeholders, in making sense of health surveillance data and using it to better achieve goals.

Uses geophysics to determine parameters (e.g., characteristics, measurements of limitations, or boundaries). Monitors processes for hydrological studies of matters (e.g., water resources, contamination, and ecological studies).

Analyzes and identifies relevant risks to all elements of the environment including humans, animals, plant life, and health. Uses this information to prevent, control, and/or manage these risks in the biosecurity sector.
Studies all aspects of healthcare and disease. Develops knowledge, interventions, and technologies for use in healthcare, to improve treatment options.
Studies the effect of radiation in and on living organisms.
Plans, organizes, and supervises the operations of assigned laboratories. Focuses on delivery of results.
Studies the morphology, ecology, genetics, and biochemistry of bacteria as well as other aspects related to them.

Uses a Coordinated Incident Management System (CIMS) to manage and respond to incidents across multiple functions and organizations. Determines common structures, functions, and terminology in a framework that is flexible, modular, and scalable then adapts these to respond to the circumstances and incident at hand.
Draws on ecology, geology, meteorology, biology, chemistry, engineering, and physics to study environmental problems and human impacts on the environment.
Develops and applies statistical methods and models to a wide range of topics in biology. Designs biological experiments, collects, and analyzes data from those experiments, and interprets results.
Studies human society, social relationships, and the way people behave and influence the world around them.
Gathers, collates, edits and submits information in response to  Request For Tenders (RFTs) / Request For Quotes (RFQs) / Request For Proposals (RFPs). Prepares bids and sends responses.

Conducts examinations and tests to detect and track potential health effects from hazardous chemical or physical exposures in the workplace. Enables early treatment or other steps to protect employee health.

Applies the Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) in the management of food safety. Addresses food safety through analyzing and controlling biological, chemical, and physical hazards from raw material production, procurement, and handling to manufacturing, distribution, and consumption of the product.
Understands the requirements and application procedures for the Food Safety System Certification (FSSC) 22000. Ensures that organizational activities comply with FSSC 22000 standards.

Measures and collects information related to the efficiency, effectiveness and reliability of the organization's health and safety programs and practices. Examines whether the program meets the organization's goals and whether the safety training and response efforts are up to standard.
Utilizes and integrates various media (e.g text, graphics, image, animation, sound, etc.) with business applications.

Anticipates, inspects, researches, and evaluates environmental factors that can arise in the workplace, which may cause sickness, impaired health, well-being, or discomfort. Puts plans in place to prevent possible issues due to these hazards.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Identifies and controls any potential safety risks that could cause harm or be considered a hazard, to both people and the workplace. Complies with regulations, specifications, or legislation. Monitors and manages any necessary permits or licenses required.

Identifies potential hazards in the handling of hazardous chemicals. Determines potential causes and effects of hazardous chemical releases with the goal of improving safety, protecting the surrounding environment, and preventing process interruptions.

competency_name: Risk Management, Security, and Information Assurance
description: Manages risks and protects knowledge, information, and data. Ensures the availability, integrity, authentication, and confidentiality of information and systems. Puts measures in place to manage risks for the protection of information and information systems, from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, and destruction.

Develops security restrictions for network access based on a person's role in the organization. Decides which level of access an employee has. Restricts access to information in line with the responsibilities and information requirements of the role.

Develops specifications and formulas for routers to determine the appropriate path onto which data should be forwarded. Draws up specifications on how routers should report changes and share information with other routers in the network, that they can reach. Ensures that the protocol allows the network to change conditions.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops and implements a Session Border Controller (SBC) to protect and regulate Internet Protocol (IP) communication flows. Uses SBC to regulate all forms of real-time communication including VoIP, IP video, text chat, and collaboration sessions.

Provides operational security management and administrative services. Authorizes and monitors access to Information Technology (IT) facilities or infrastructure. Investigates unauthorized access and compliance with relevant legislation.
Virtualizes and abstracts a compute function from the hardware it is on and creates an operation that can be managed through a central interface.

Designs data storage facilities in which all infrastructure elements (e.g., networking, storage, CPU, and security) are virtualized and delivered as a service. Abstracts deployment, operation, provisioning, and configuration from hardware. Implements these tasks through software intelligence.

Develops technical computing infrastructure that is entirely under the control of software with no operator or human intervention. Develops this infrastructure to operate independently of any hardware-specific dependencies and ensures that it is programmatically extensible.
Streams live or recorded media content via the Internet to computers or mobile devices/electronics. Plays streaming content back in real-time through podcasts, webcasts, movies, or music videos.

Experience in systems selection, management, and rollout. Demonstrates extensive knowledge of business processes, system capabilities, infrastructure, and the resulting business application and impact.

Follows systems installation/decommissioning protocols to install, test, implement, or decommission. Removes cabling, wiring, equipment, hardware, and associated software. Reports on the details of hardware and software installed for configuration management record purposes.
Integrates existing and/or disparate systems to improve product quality and performance. Presents with development experience working on system integration projects (e.g., inbound/outbound data).
Writes programming tests that are first intended to fail before new functional code is developed.

Designs diagrams based on the UML to visually represent a system along with its key players, roles, actions, artifacts, or classes, to better understand, alter, maintain, or document information about the system.
Uses Unified Modeling Language (UML) to specify, visualize, construct, and document the artifacts of software systems as well as for business modeling and other non-software systems.
Uses wireless technology to communicate between two or more entities over distances without the use of wires or cables of any sort (e.g., WiFi, cellular communication, Bluetooth, radio waves).
Uses or manages a cloud-based service by means of an application via an internet browser (e.g., office software, unified communications, or other business applications).

Identifies risks that an organization faces and advises on how to avoid or address these risks. Implements controls to protect the organization from these risks. Monitors and reports on the effectiveness of controls.
Monitors a network for malicious activity or policy violations. Reports or collects any activity or violation using security information and event management system.

Develops and applies software solutions that aggregate and analyze activities from different resources, across the organization's Information Technology (IT) infrastructure. Collects security data from network devices, servers, domain controllers, and the like.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Collects, processes, and analyzes raw data in order to make informed decisions about possible threats that the organization may face. Prepares, prevents, and identifies threats.

Conducts testing to verify/accept a software system before moving the application to the production environment. Validates end-to-end business flow. Verifies that the created solution/software works for "the user."
Identifies, minimizes damage and reduces the costs of cyber-attacks while finding and fixing the causes to prevent future attacks. Handles security incidents, breaches, and cyber threats.
Designs and implements software to prevent, detect, and help remove threats efficiently from computer systems.
Develops, adds, and tests security features within applications. Prevents security vulnerabilities against unauthorized access and modification threats.

Aligns cybersecurity strategies with business vision, goals, and innovation projects. Implements it to enhance product integrity, customer experience, operations, regulatory compliance, brand reputation, and investor confidence. Leads to a return on cyber investments.

competency_name: Firewall/Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS)/Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) Skills
description: Configures and deploys systems to identify, resolve, and block any malicious activities trying to exploit a known vulnerability.
Applies Translations Management Systems (TMS) to manage the localization and translation of language assets at scale.
Develops systems to protect health information and information systems from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction.
Creates, articulates, and implements a structured set of roles, responsibilities, and accountabilities for all stakeholders. Supports and enables the delivery of transformative roadmaps.

Creates, articulates, and implements a structured vision into short, mid, and long-term objectives to address the outcome of security assessments. Drives, tracks, and measures progress against milestones.
Creates models which include key activities for all stakeholders to operate the transformed practice, and ensure its functional stability going forward.
Plots data on control or trend charts to identify variations in a process or its outputs over time.

Devises strategies to track and improve Information Technology (IT) service management by applying the Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) framework. Stays informed on updates to this framework and applies these in practice.

Complies with the global standards for the minimum requirement of an Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) system. Stays informed on updates to these standards and applies these in practice.

Devises strategies to track and improve information technology governance and management by applying the COBIT framework. Stays informed on updates to this framework and its principles and enablers and applies these in practice.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Creates, builds, and fosters valued relationships between the provider and the business units they serve. Stimulates, surfaces, and shapes business demand for the company's products and services.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Examines data or content using sophisticated techniques and tools to discover deeper insights, make predictions, and generate recommendations. Uses various devices (e.g., machine learning, artificial intelligence, multivariate statistics, neural networks, pattern matching, forecasting, and visualization).
Creates, analyzes, and grows an organization's security guiding principles, architecture, structure, and performance management. Supports security information, applications, and technology.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide security practices within the organization.
Creates, implements, and uses formal disciplines, practices, and standards for improving the effectiveness, efficiency, and safety of Video/Voice Communication processes and procedures.

Manages coworking between Information Technology (IT) and the rest of the business to ensure uniformity, accuracy, stewardship, semantic consistency, and accountability of its official shared master data assets.
Implements, operates, supports, updates, and works on the applicable Systems, Applications, and Products (SAP) suite of software and applications.

Uses a range of techniques to alter or augment the behavior of an operating system, application, or other software components by intercepting function calls, messages, or events that are passed between software components.
Uses scientific and Information Technology (IT) principles and practices to design and build Cloud, DevOps and Security solutions as required by the business.
Assesses software based products to ascertain how well it meets users' needs. Considers the probability of failure-free software operations for a specific time in a specific environment.
Designs, installs, implements and maintains the infrastructure network of the organization. Troubleshoots hardware, software and networking problems.
Gains insight of business processes through the data in the Information Technology (IT) systems. Uses these insights to design, execute and automate manual tasks or processes based on workflow rules.

Integrates virtual content with the physical environment in such a way that allows users to engage naturally with blended reality. Expands or replaces the physical world through creating 360 spaces which allows users to look in any direction and see content.
Uses 3D computer aided design (CAD) to enable fast fabrication of a physical part, model, or assembly.
Develops both frontend and backend portions of applications. Acts as a full stack developer. Works on the frontend, backend, database and debugging of applications.
Analyzes the design of software programs to ensure that it can integrate with specific systems. Offers technical support during software preparation, installation and system maintenance.
Develops, implements, and/or manages the system where all aspects of the organization's systems, processes, and standards are combined into one smart system.
Develops, implements, and uses tools that provide network analysis and connection facilities to allow people to understand community structures and influence them over time.
Develops, implements, or outsources application development and support platforms. Delivers application infrastructure/middleware capabilities as a service.
Understands Scala concepts and applications. Uses Scala programming language to do object-oriented and functional programming on a large scale.
Creates moving visual content to communicate messages. Sets abstract objects, text, and other graphic design elements in motion.
Uses computer graphics to produce a 3-D digital representation of an object or surface, to fully animate the object.

Manages and implements systems to ensure that access to resources is allocated to the correct people for the appropriate reasons. This includes aligning with both business and compliance requirements.

Displays knowledge of electronic media devices and equipment that includes both an audio and visual component. Operates, maintains, updates, and stores this equipment for events that include presentations, speakers, music, and beyond.

Designs, develops and implements the frameworks for how IT infrastructure supports the organization's data strategy. Considers the models, policies, procedures, and standards that govern how data is gathered, stored, integrated, and arranged in the company.
Manages and implements the process of selecting, preparing, separating, and transforming data and then moves it from one computer storage system to another.
Manages the process of data transmission between two or more digital devices.
Evaluates systems, applications, and business process security to identify vulnerabilities. Make suggestions to counter potential threats or optimize where feasible.
Identifies, gathers, preserves, and evaluates data in a way that maintains enough integrity to ensure it is deemed admissible as evidence in a court of law.

Assesses the potential threat business activities and resource requirements have on the resilience and continuity of a business, during or after a disruption. Quantifies the risks, impact on service delivery, and recovery point objectives to inform strategies or routes forward.

Reviews source data and collects statistics and informative summaries to best understand the data's structure, content, and interrelationships. Identifies data projects possible with the data available.
Establishes templates for data cleaning, removes duplicates or corrupted data, formats data, and manages naming conventions, typos, inconsistencies, missing data, etc.
Incorporates new information into an existing database to improve the completeness and accuracy of data.
Combines data from different sources into a single, unified view to produce effective business intelligence.
Builds an identifiable persona and reputation for the company through copy, voice, logos, color palettes, and so forth.
Localizes content (e.g., website, applications, or software) into other languages to reflect local tastes, buying preferences, payment options, and habits.

Applies knowledge of potential customers that may impact their user experience across apps, websites, and software. Manages, monitors, and optimizes the tone, look and,  feel to ensure maximum relevance for the target market.

Translates software, websites, or applications for all target markets/audiences across diverse cultures by adjusting the product's tone, look, and feel. Ensures an enjoyable and natural user experience.

Manages the process of mediation by assisting different parties in litigation to resolve the dispute. Facilitates the discussion to find issues, clarify priorities, explore areas of compromise, and generate other options for resolution.

Manages and optimizes the acquisition, deployment, upkeep, and use of software applications within the organization. This includes all the infrastructure and processes required to manage software assets throughout their lifecycle.
Uses Office programs to complete daily tasks efficiently (e.g., MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Automates software patch deployment to ensure computers are aligned with the relevant security and efficiency standards.
Ensures software is ready for deployment for full roll out to the customer. Verifies all activities that make a system available for use are tested and in place.
Manages tools that identify software installed across the computer network. Records and monitors details (e.g., title, product ID, size, date, path, and version).
Tracks and maintains software licenses across the network to ensure real-time license compliance.
Applies science to develop solutions to health problems or issues (e.g., the prevention or delay of onset of diseases or the promotion and monitoring of good health).
Applies naming conventions to capture product-specific information (e.g., name, edition, version, and license agreement types). Optimizes asset management by mapping between technologies.
Implements security tools to ensure monitoring and control of software use within the organization. Ensures reduced security risk and protects against potential threats.
Creates new Information Technology (IT) Security processes. Maps the series of steps that are critical to the given task, to reduce errors, security risks, and optimize safety in the IT environment.

Applies more advanced layers of security controls, including source reputation, executable analysis, and threat-level protocols to identify advanced targeted threats that prevailing controls could not detect.
Manages, plans, and keeps track of the resources that enable communications in an Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) environment.
Uses Salesforce, a cloud-based customer relationship management (CRM) platform, to manage interactions with sales prospects and customers with the objective of driving business growth.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of Game Development, locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Applies knowledge of scrum methodology's principles, components, and features to best manage software product development processes.
Manages data requirements and how it is acquired. This includes source data, data entry, queries, quality control and correction, and the concept of a locked database.
Controls the site and assigns access and administration rights to trusted and qualifying users.
Processes necessary information to onboard new vendors for the organization. Follows vendor onboarding best practices, vetting and validation processes to ensure more efficient purchasing process.

Removes the ownership of a computer or electronic storage device from the business and hands it over to a third party for recycling or disposal. Strips all redundant Information Technology (IT) assets of all sensitive personal data before sending it for recycling.
Extracts and integrates data from several sources (internal and external) to create the organization's data infrastructure that is used for handling workflows and achieving business objectives.
Uses Microsoft Power BI, a business intelligence platform, to aggregate, analyze, visualize and share organizational data.
Utilizes CIM software and other processes and practices to acquire, maintain and update customer demographics, product possession, and life-cycle information.

Studies computational systems, most notably those for data storage and retrieval. Shows an understanding and interest in how information is collected, stored, manipulated, classified, organized, retrieved, and visualized.

Gathers and organizes business data through an integrated software suite. Uses ERP software, containing applications which automate business functions across all departments such as sales, production, accounting, HR, etc., to optimize business processes.
Performs routine tasks as a non-lawyer that require some knowledge of the law and procedures. Handles a lot of the paperwork for practicing lawyers and attorneys.
Monitors, analyzes, and executes performance tweaks of a database management system (DBMS) to increase its efficiency and optimize performance.
Creates and manages a comprehensive plan that details of how technology should be used to meet Information Technology (IT) and business goals.

Develops and provides automation of software builds and validation processes. Practices continuous integration through merging changes back to the main branch regularly. Validates changes through building and running automated tests against the build.
Addresses the upkeep and maintenance of different servers in an organization. Displays an understanding and knowledge of server administration systems and procedures.

Manages the technologies that make up data infrastructure, which may include hardware, software, and cloud or managed services, servers, storage and networking, the bodies that maintain them, and guides that explain how to use the collected data.
Takes responsibility for all processes involved in getting software and/or hardware up and running which may include installation, configuration, running, testing, and making changes where required.
Enhances and monitors network performance through the use of specific tools, techniques and best practices. Measures network performance metrics, identifies issues, and put fixes in place for this.

Uses Artificial Intelligence to train computers to interpret and derive meaningful information from digital images, videos and other visual inputs, and take actions or make recommendations based on that information.
Uses computer software to produce an object or graphic in a virtual three-dimensional space.
Releases new software applications or features more quickly by using automated processes to streamline the movement between testing and production environments.

Integrates hardware systems and software applications by using services and technologies across an enterprise. Uses this to streamline business processes without the need to make unnecessary application or data structure changes.
Studies computers to identify areas of improvement. Fixes defects and/or modifies computers to correct faults to improve performance.
Uses artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms and techniques to create or assist in the creation of art.
Uses an abstraction layer to hide the implementation details of underlying (back-end) functionality within a computer system. This separation simplifies interoperability and platform independence.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Uses or implements a system or platform that integrates computing, data storage, networking, and virtualization to create an efficient, centrally managed data center architecture.

Manages and monitors the operations of the Active Directory Management service to ensure that it is acting as required. Includes the automation of Active Directory user provisioning processes, security, regulations and audit compliance, and user access.
Utilizes recurring or reusable components to solve user interface design problems.
Identifies and isolates the source of an error and finds a way to correct or work around the error. Tests the solution or workaround to ensure it works effectively.
Measures how effectively a website is designed and how user-friendly the website is to ensure user satisfaction.
Manages information in a consistent manner from creation to retirement. Optimizes information's utility, aims to lower costs, and diminishes compliance and legal risks.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Advises internal and external clients on Information Technology uses, trends, processes, policies and procedures. Enables the client to make better decisions in terms of using information technology and digital assets to optimally achieve their business goals.

Designs and implements different ways to share data across ecosystems while still ensuring privacy. Utilizes various approaches such as encrypting, splitting, or preprocessing sensitive information to ensure confidentiality is maintained.

Uses the principles of systems engineering, software engineering, computer science, and human-centered design to create and test Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems that are in-line with the human needs for a project.

Uses Enterprise Application Software (EAS) to satisfy several needs of an entire or a large part of an enterprise. Controls major business processes with a single software architecture on a server or client platform.
Uses a micro-processor-based computer hardware system with corresponding software that is designed to perform a dedicated function.
Uses cloud-based accreditation management software to simplify the configuration of accreditation processes.

competency_name: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) Pipeline
description: Improves software delivery throughout the software development life cycle by automating the building, testing, and deployment of applications. Bridges the gap between the development and operations teams.

Undertakes the planning, scheduling, controlling, and testing of the movement of releases in a live environment. Aims to protect the integrity of the live environment. Ensures the correct components are released.
Discovers users' behaviors, motivations, and needs through interviews, task analysis, surveys, and other types of user feedback. Uses various research methods to collect and analyze the feedback.
Develops the graphical user interface of websites using web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript so that users can interact with websites directly.
Supports clients through the process of taking their case to a court of law so that a judgment can be made.
Devises a strategy to upgrade or implement changes to an application with the least downtime or impact on the user.
Applies continuous software testing tools to ensure the quality of the software is tested at every stage of the development lifecycle.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Designs computer-based technologies and aggregates computing power to deliver much higher performance than one would get from traditional computers. Uses these to perform complex computations at high speeds to solve the most complicated computing problems in science, engineering, or business.
Applies knowledge of the architecture and operation of large language models (LLMs),  which are machine-learning models designed to process and generate human-like language.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops, assesses, and/or deploys artificial intelligence (AI) systems in a trustworthy, safe, and ethical manner. Ensures that AI technologies are designed and utilized in alignment with human values, while respecting fundamental rights and proactively addressing potential harmful consequences.
Defines and documents business plans, objectives, projects, or programs for a work area or function. Includes a statement of goals, reasons they are attainable, and plans for reaching them.
Devises a plan that the organization can fall back on while trying to operate without certain resources to ensure its continuity and continued revenue.

Ensures that the organization has the appropriate controls and policies in place. Ensures everyone follows the appropriate decision-making processes to protect the interests of all stakeholders (e.g. shareholders, managers, employees, suppliers, customers, etc.).
Provides services involving legal or law-related matters, like issuing of a legal opinion, filing, pleading, and defending lawsuits, etc., by a practicing lawyer or attorney.
Draws companies together from multiple industries and collectively seeks opportunities for differentiated value propositions to target customer segments that may not have been accessible before.

Conducts a thorough investigation or audit before making a business decision. Verifies the accuracy of information provided by the 3rd party (e.g., seller, vendor, employee, etc.). Makes informed decisions.
Designs, distributes, and manages legal documents that record the formal execution of legally enforceable acts or agreements. Secures associated legal rights, obligations, and duties.
Creates the processes, tools, and training to enable the organization to respond quickly to customer needs and market changes whilst controlling costs and quality.
Keeps a watchful eye on the economic conditions of the countries in which the organization operates and pre-empts how these conditions could potentially affect the organization and its operations.
Understands processes, tools, and techniques for assessing and controlling an organization's exposure to environmental and social risks of various kinds. Applies this knowledge to diverse situations.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops policies and strategies for communicating financial data and insight between the organization and its investment community (e.g., investors, shareholders, and other interested parties). Convinces this investment community of the financial stability of the organization.
Identifies and assesses new potential markets for the organization to expand its business into. Develops plans to enter these markets and increase revenue and market footprint.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops policies and strategies for communicating with the organization's constituencies, employees, and stakeholders as well as with the community at large. Ensures the ongoing flow of relevant and important information on the organization and its operations.

Drives a certain profit margin for the business unit based on business objectives and goals. Develops different strategies for increasing revenue and decreasing expenses to ensure a healthier profit and loss statement. Adjusts remaining budget to regain/maintain profitability target.

Maintains a favorable public image of the organization by managing the release of information from the organization. Builds the brand, spreads the organization's message, and minimizes the effect of negative publicity.

Understands the positive impact of investment sectors and brings together both financial and values-based considerations when making investment decisions. Analyzes and evaluates green initiatives, market and industry trends, major issues, and regulatory considerations.
Compares actual performance against desired performance and identifies the steps needed to move the business to the desired position.

Uses a variety of internal and external information sources available to a client or the organization, to identify issues and trends. Studies financial, economic, and technical information to identify ways to achieve long-range goals or meet the vision of the organization.

Leads organizational agility by aligning efforts and resources, bringing value to the activity, minimizing disruption, and achieving strategic and operational results. Democratizes strategy by setting visionary goals, while enabling employees to find innovative ways to solve the problems and contribute to the vision.
Utilizes agile methodologies in a team that is spread across two or more geographical locations.
Researches, stays up to date, and implements the regulations and policies that dictate how a company in one country can conduct business with companies in other countries.
