Provides advice and support to build and strengthen the financial sustainability of comprehensive social protection systems.
Develops strategies to improve people's freedom and opportunities as well as their well-being.
Develops policies based on expected shifts in government, societal, and technology megatrends. Devises many scenarios to respond to these trends.
Identifies needs, gathers information, drafts, consults, and reviews proposed policies.

competency_name: Knowledge of Gender and Development Issues
description: Understands the inherent bias in the distribution of development support based on gender. Challenges this bias and works toward fair and inclusive access for all.
Considers gender-based differences and issues in the design of the policy, strategy, plan, or program. Promotes gender equality in the implementation of these.

Ensures the meaningful, informed, and effective participation of women and girls with diverse backgrounds in key decision-making processes, regarding climate change action. Takes gender-based differences into account when designing climate actions.

Creates equal opportunities for women to take part in existing markets, access and control productive resources, access decent work, control their own time, lives and bodies, and have an increased voice, agency, and meaningful participation in economic decision-making.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Conducts a quality audit by systematically and independently examining quality systems or quality management systems. Presents findings and a report on whether it meets requirements and conforms to specifications.

Brings together societal and personal influences to raise awareness and demand for health care. Assists in the delivery of resources and services. Cultivates sustainable individual and community involvement.
Devises strategies to prevent and punish violence (e.g., verbal, sexual, physical, emotional, psychological, etc.) against an individual based on their biological sex or gender orientation.
Gives citizens an active voice and welcomes them to influence civic governance to improve development outcomes and government accountability.

Strengthens and supports constructive relationships across ethnic, religious, class, national, and racial boundaries. Uses the following techniques: conflict prevention, conflict management, conflict resolution, and post-conflict reconciliation.
Determines what causes conflict by analyzing economic, social, political, and environmental factors. Devises strategies to mitigate these and drive long-term, positive change.
Assists in creating a non-bureaucratic civil service to ensure good governance. Improves service delivery and enhances public management and personnel management.

Determines climate-related peace, security, and development risks by collating and analyzing reliable, relevant, and timely information. Monitors changes in these risks and devises mitigating strategies.
Supports a nation to reach a point where destructive conflict, oppression, and violence are no longer used to solve problems.
Understands the various techniques to help end disputes or neutralize conflict between nations.
Assists two parties to reach a mutual agreement that leads to peace in a constructive and non-violent way.
Develops and implements programs to foster shared values among communities and to reduce disparities in wealth and income.
Works with groups of people representing a special interest to understand and resolve issues affecting the well-being of the people this group represents.
Develops programs that support youth in taking charge of their lives and making informed decisions about their futures.
Develops and implements economic and humanitarian efforts to lift people out of poverty.
Devises measurable strategic goals to meet within a specific time. Determines the criteria to check whether these goals were met.
Executes infrastructure plans and ensures that these meet the needs of the present generation without compromising the future generation.
Develops and implements programs to ensure all community members have access to water and sanitation. Addresses issues with the delivery of these basic services.
Identifies and mitigates any negative effects of industrial projects. Identifies opportunities to enhance benefits for local communities and broader society.
Builds an inclusive society grounded in the values of equity, equality, social justice, and freedom. Designs initiatives to promote tolerance and embrace diversity.

Identifies and addresses immediate and medium-term recovery and peacebuilding requirements. Lays the foundation for the elaboration of longer-term recovery and peacebuilding strategies. Coordinates reengagement in countries or regions emerging from conflict or political crisis.
Uses methods and tools to determine the impact of various elements of crisis and post-crisis situations.
Brings various humanitarian partners together to organize relief and recovery operations after a humanitarian crisis.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Evaluates, develops, and implements methods and tools to deal with crisis situations.
Provides support and implements mechanisms, processes, and resources in response to disaster/crisis.
Evaluates and implements appropriate Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) concepts, frameworks, and principles. Applies these to strategic and practical situations.
Allows citizens to take part in government decision-making. Encourages fair and inclusive policies, regulations, and programs.
Coordinates individual and collective actions to identify and address issues of public concern. Aims to promote the quality of life in a community.
Assesses the socio-economic impact of landmines and other explosive remnants on communities to determine the most needed actions. Maps, marks, and clears mines.
Develops and evaluates programs that provide services to members of a community within its jurisdiction. Aims to improve these services and the livelihood of its people.
Works with many stakeholders to bring about knowledge capturing, knowledge transfer, and knowledge creation. Fosters sustainable innovation that will continue to promote competitiveness.

Seeks to expand choices for all people, including current and future generations, while protecting the natural systems on which all life depends. Aims to end poverty, promote human dignity and rights, and provide fair opportunities for all.
Focuses on and implements procedures to uphold the sanctity of an individual before the law and guarantee their ability to take part in civil, economic, and political society.
Focuses on and implements procedures, programs, and initiatives that promote individual flourishing, social and economic development, self-esteem, and identity.
Develops programs to help migrants reintegrate back into their communities with ease.
Understands the various tools and concepts for migration and development and their application.
Uses various indicators to establish whether a program has reached its aims and objectives.
Combines the collection and analysis of data to assess the extent to which a program or intervention has not met its objectives.

Assesses areas to identify and reduce the impact and risk of explosive hazards to a safe level. Acts to protect people from danger. Helps victims become self-sufficient and provide stability and sustainable development opportunities.
Raises public awareness about mines and unexploded ordnance (UXO) to initiate behavioral change and risk avoidance.
Provides medical, rehabilitation, and vocational services to mines and unexploded ordnance (UXO) survivors.
Collects, analyzes, interprets, and shares information on mines and unexploded ordnance (UXO) threats to assist the planning of mine action projects.

Understands and incorporates the International Mine Action Standards (IMAS) when planning, conducting, or reporting mine action operations. Drives safety, quality, and efficiency throughout the application of IMAS.
Devises strategies and regulations to enable an economy to mitigate or recover from a recession.
Uses a Quality Management System (QMS) to document processes, procedures, and responsibilities to achieve quality policies and objectives.
Finds the root cause of problems and develops solutions. Informs the organization to prevent the problem from reoccurring.
Creates clear plans to deal effectively with any dangerous occurrence (e.g., natural disasters, hazardous material incidents, public unrest, transportation incidents, or accidents, etc.).
Understands the policies and procedures related to safety and displays the ability to respond within the framework.
Reviews the quality of all factors involved in production. Investigates products to ensure that quality is maintained or improved.
Designs and uses documents that provide requirements, specifications, guidelines, or characteristics to ensure that materials, products, processes, and services are fit for their purpose.
Tests units, parts, or products to determine any needs for corrective action in the manufacturing process. Ensures quality using testing.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Uses tools as a quality measurement to assess or quantify processes, outcomes, customer perceptions, and organizational structure and/or systems that are associated with the ability to provide high-quality service or care and/or relate to one or more quality goals.
Follows a set of procedures that ensure the deliverables produced by a team are fit for purpose. Sets quality targets which are agreed upon with the customer.
Deals with customers in a respectful and helpful way. Ensures that the perceived expectations of a service match the perceived performance and are in line with customer expectations.

competency_name: Quality System Procedures, Instructions, and Records
description: Ensures that the procedures and instructions to use the organization's Quality Management System (QMS) are documented and updated as required.

Implements techniques to check that a product, service, or system meets requirements and specifications, and that it fulfills its intended purpose. Forms a critical part of the quality management system.

competency_name: Validation and Qualification Policies, Procedures and Programs
description: Identifies, develops and implements a set of validation policies, procedures, and programs related to facilities, processes, equipment, and automated systems. Focuses on continuous improvement that is consistent with established and evolving regulatory and company requirements.

Reports specification deviation or work that fails to meet quality standards as part of quality control processes by detailing the problem, how it occurred, and how to prevent it from happening again.
Builds a test plan, to outline the focus of testing and ensure resources are in place to achieve test objectives.
Tests final names in the context of package, concept, or product testing so that all variables are implicitly incorporated into the name test.
Runs collective brainstorming sessions with creative individuals through internal and external sources to help generate new product ideas. Condenses the number of brainstormed ideas.

Collects data on consumers, competitors, and the marketplace. Consolidates information into actionable items, reports, and presentations. Performs a valid and reliable market research Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats (SWOT) analysis.
Leads the planning, forecasting, and production of a product/s to the production readiness stage. Manages the process, strategy, and resources of new product development.
Improves an existing product, that is already marketed and sold to consumers, in a minor or significant manner, to gain new customers or provide increased benefits for existing customers.

Manages data and processes used in the design, engineering, manufacturing, sales, and service of a product across its entire lifecycle. Makes product information available to teams across the organization to help mitigate issues and align and integrate key resources.

Evaluates, selects, and prioritizes the organization's list of new products and projects. Accelerates, kills, or de-prioritizes existing products and projects. Aims to maximize the portfolio value, identify risks and opportunities, achieve the right mix of products or projects, and link the portfolio to the organization's strategy.
Defines clear goals and objectives of new and existing products. Uses these goals to guide the product roadmap.
Measures a products performance and customer satisfaction. Measures the effect of price, brand name and packaging on the success of the product. Monitors product quality.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Creates an early/sample version of the product being developed to test a concept/idea. Provides valuable input around the feasibility of the idea. Determines and monitors product value by maximizing the financial return. Ensures a competitive advantage and the efficient allocation of resources.
Gathers quantifiable data and uses statistical, mathematical, or computational techniques to gather and draw conclusions from the data.
Identifies market changes and new product opportunities. Converts customer and market requirements into products.
Develops hypotheses, applies theory and research methods, and analyzes and reports on the results.

Follows the relevant writing style guidelines to capture research findings. Presents thoughts in a logical progression, makes rational arguments and acknowledges ideas, quotations, or images from another source.
Develops and implements systems that can be used for storing, managing, or reporting data that is used for research purposes.
Uses various research methods to collect data from web-based sources.
Designs and develops products of high quality using agile methodologies in an interactive and collaborative environment through self-organizing teams.
Creates a high-level visual summary that maps out the vision and direction of a new product offering over time.

Develops and applies data-analytical tools, theoretical methods, mathematical modeling, and software simulation techniques to explore biological systems and relationships. Collects and analyzes complex biological data (e.g., genetic codes).
Applies computational technology to handle the growing body of information related to molecular biology. Collects and analyzes complex biological data (e.g., genetic codes).
Applies the laws of mechanics to biology and the movement of bodies. Studies the structure, function, and motion of the mechanical aspects of biological systems.

Manages the facility's operations, resources, and employee resources. Arranges for maintenance, alterations, repairs, and renovations. Ensures safety and care. Makes sure that the organization and facility complies with regulations, legislation, and codes of practice relevant to the animal laboratory.
Develops and delivers research documents/proposals. Includes the problem statement, approach to follow, deliverables, experience, and skills of the person who will work on the project and cost.
Aims to prevent errors to ensure the technical integrity of products, processes, and systems. Identifies early omissions in design and confirms that it meets requirements.
Receives and distributes incoming and outgoing packages. Maintains a record of all incoming and outgoing packages.

Complies with all regulations on the use of animals in laboratory testing. Includes nutrition, sanitation, housing, transportation, veterinary care, noise control, behavioral and social aspects of testing on animals.
Researches information provided in written documents to verify the accuracy.

Establishes the need for data collection, which statistics is required and will be produced, who is the population that will be studied, what accuracy is required and what the methods are by which those data will be collected and processed to produce the required information or statistics.

Creates a diagram showing the screens that make up the user interface of a system, including how to navigate between them. Assists software developers to visualize and optimize the user interface of a system before the build begins.
Designs products and the relevant manufacturing process to transition an innovative concept through to a sellable product.
Manages the process of receiving, tracking, and fulfilling customer orders as well as the return of orders.
Oversees the operation, control, maintenance, and oversight of residential, commercial, and industrial real estate as well as other physical property.
Formalizes the relationship between owner and lessee regarding payments, maintenance, rules of conduct, etc.
Plans the set of elements to attract in-store customers (e.g., layout, comfort, privacy, architecture, sales equipment, colors as well as product displays).
Oversees rental operations including screening tenants, rent collections, evictions, maintenance, and buying and selling property (e.g., residential/commercial real estate).
Assesses client's needs, motivators, and expectations when it comes to purchasing real estate.
Packages selected items on order. Ensures goods travel safely and cost-effectively.
Ensures adherence to guidelines and regulations that pertains to properties and their components.

Analyzes similar retail products and services in the external retail environment. Uses this information to create and carry out strategies, practices, and tools to communicate information about the retail competition.
Analyzes the profitability of an organization's output with the view to improve or optimize profitability.
Applies a set of processes and steps to reduce profit loss and preserve profit.

Applies knowledge of the full spectrum of activities for retail facilities planning, operation, and maintenance. Develops and maintains the physical environment of the retail facility to ensure it is conducive to retail activities.
Processes daily procurement tasks using the organization's preferred procurement platform.

Applies retail industry knowledge appropriately to diverse situations. Understands how the selling of finished products to end-user consumers works. Understands the industry's trends, directions, key issues, regulatory considerations, and trendsetters.
Clarifies retail contract-related facts. Measures feasibility of contracts and forecasts contract risks.

Designs and displays merchandise in a retail setting in order to engage shoppers and boost sales. Creates displays that accentuates a product's appearance, features, benefits and uses in visually compelling way.

Designs, develops, and implements warehouse distribution and logistics solutions that enable a retail organization to manage and control factors that lie between the purchase of goods, materials, and supplies and their delivery to the point of sales.

Develops and implements persuasive marketing and sales strategies designed to increase sales. Uses technologies to stimulate the demand for a particular product and increase brand awareness. Creates a feeling of time sensitivity, generates new leads, and keeps existing customers interested.

Develops and manages businesses where a franchisor provides a licensed privilege to the franchisee to do business. Assists in organizing, training, merchandising, marketing, and managing in return for a monetary consideration. Obtains distribution through affiliated dealers and established relationships.
Develops, implements, and monitors measures and techniques for merchandise protection and to ensure a more secure sales environment. Protects retail stores from crimes.
Exchanges money electronically to pay for either a service or a product.
Finds and acquires goods, agrees to terms, and makes buying decisions in the retail environment.

Promotes goods and services that are available for retail sales. Determines quantities, sets prices for goods and services, creates display designs, develops marketing strategies, and establishes discounts or coupons.

Gathers and analyzes relevant data to inform decision-making and identify opportunities. Utilizes this information to provide a comprehensive perspective on retail business directives and strategic objectives.
Identifies, develops, and implements a set of policies and procedures that is in line with government laws and regulations, to effectively manage the online retail process.
Identifies, develops, and implements a set of policies and procedures that is in line with the government laws and regulations to effectively manage the returns policy.

Keeps abreast with trends, direction, developments, and technologies within the field of retail, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure retail relevancy and competitiveness.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Manages all the activities in a retail environment that ensures it functions well. Accepts responsibility for people management, supply chain, the layout of the store, cash operations, managing the physical inventory, managing the master data, promotions and pricing, and other required tasks.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Oversees the movement of goods from the distribution center to the point of sale. Accepts responsibility for tasks (e.g., packaging, inventory, warehousing, supply chain, and logistics).
Owns and operates a specific place of business where merchandise is sold to customers.
Performs retail administrative tasks to support the sales team and help them to gain and keep customers. Monitors retail sales targets and records sales data.
Plans and uses the floor space in a retail environment effectively to facilitate the customers and increase sales.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Uses data and insights to predict how much of a specific product or service customers might want to purchase during a defined period of time. Predicts consumer behavior.
Researches the market and adds a margin to wholesale prices when setting prices for retail products and services based on various factors.

Understands and manages the store inventory which is a record of all the items available in the retail operations. Tracks and reports the changes in the inventory to evaluate retail performance, set plans, or detect theft.

Understands how retail contracts are managed and administered. Develops and applies the correct policies, standards, and processes when managing and administering contractual agreements in the retail environment.
Understands various retail channels. Investigates, selects, and supports the best channels for selling goods to consumers.
Understands, plans, and manages daily operations of the retail call center (e.g., forecasting, scheduling, employee training, reporting, and all customer interactions or escalations).
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Uses store advertising to drive awareness and interest towards products to generate sales from a target audience.
Uses technology-integrated software applications to address any specialized managerial and mission-critical operational needs of retail shops.
Manages cash, checks, credit card data, money orders, debit cards, and other forms of inflow and outflow.
Plans the movement of drugs from one location to another using the various modes of transport. Ensures that transportation adheres to regulatory requirements as well as health and safety measures.
Selects the items as specified on the order. Ensures the right items and quantities are sent to be packaged.
Follows processes when procuring products or services and ensures that purchases are made with suppliers that have been pre-approved/contracted.

Gathers information to assess and analyze store performance over time. Captures critical data regarding products, sales, merchandising, compliance, pricing, store conditions, competitive intelligence, and many other factors that contribute to retail sales.

Develops ideas, initiatives, and activities that help to improve a retail business. Focuses on increasing revenue, retail business expansion, and profitability by building strategic partnerships and making strategic retail business decisions.
Plans, selects, and purchases quantities of goods and merchandise sold in retail stores. Sources new and reviews existing goods to ensure products remain competitive.
Creates software platforms and technologies that will provide retailers with the means to improve customer experience and operational efficiency by accelerating and optimizing the return processes.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Uses historical sales data and develops estimates and forecasts of customer demand. Feeds this information into the purchasing and production processes.

Transfers goods and services from the raw material suppliers and producers to the end-users or consumers. Chooses shipping methods, considering the trade-offs between costs and benefits. Ensures efficient use of transportation resources while meeting the needs of the customer.
Conducts planning to control all materials among the various locations. Decides how to distribute the goods between these locations to meet anticipated needs.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Defines and monitors pre-fulfilment processes to ensure customers can receive their orders quickly and efficiently.

Uses Information Technology (IT) tools for efficient production operations and back-office support. Covers database management, customer relationship management, supply chain management, business process management, etc.
Ensures that all industrial robots used in production are programmed correctly and functioning optimally. Ensures proper maintenance of these robots.

Understands the difference between the four types of inventory: Raw Materials, Work-In-Progress (WIP), Finished Goods, and Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul (MRO). Uses this knowledge to make better financial decisions for the organization's supply chain.

Monitors inventory levels. Ensures the right amount of inventory to be able to fulfill the customers' needs without incurring unnecessary storage and other costs. Ensures real-time inventory orchestration and allocation of inventory in motion and at rest.

Manages the process of planning how much of a given product will need to be produced at a given point to meet demand. Ensures adequate amounts are produced so as not to risk wasting inventory space, spoilage, etc. Prevents stock-outs due to insufficient planning and production.
Develops processes for the movement, protection, storage, and control of materials and products throughout the supply chain process.
Investigates and implements mobile business software to manage the procurement process of an organization from a mobile device.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide procurement practices for both direct (raw materials and goods for production) and indirect (day to day) purchases.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of procurement, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure organization's relevancy and competitiveness.

Issues documents to a seller indicating types, quantities, and agreed prices for products or services. Ensures each purchase order includes all the details as required to eliminate any discrepancies during invoicing.
Analyzes products and suppliers to determine benchmarking costs. Identifies spend consolidation and savings opportunities. Creates full visibility of spend by vendor, category, and location.
Assigns a Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) to each distinct type of product or service to distinguish it from other types.

Locates and sources key suppliers of raw materials or products while analyzing the total cost associated with procuring an item or service. Improves and re-evaluates purchasing activities of the organization.
Designs, develops, and implements warehouse, distribution, and logistics solutions that enable the organization to achieve its business goals and objectives.
Understands key principles and priorities central to effective supply chain management. Understands the market dynamics and the economies of scale, supply, and demand.
Processes daily supply chain tasks using the organization's preferred supply chain platform.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that ensure effective and economical management of the supply chain.
Calculates the risk of the effect of climate change on the supply of the organization's key commodities.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of supply chain, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Plans the movement of goods from one location to another using the various modes of transport (e.g., air, rail, road, water, cable, pipeline, and space).
Ensures that a vendor of a certain product takes full responsibility for maintaining an agreed inventory of the material.

Requests vendors/suppliers to fulfil a business requirement that the organization has through Request for Proposals (RfPs). Assessing potential vendors/suppliers to the organization against a set of established criteria.
Utilizes various techniques and resources to structure training experiences for players.
Controls the movement in (receiving) and out (shipping) of a warehouse as well as the physical storage of materials and products within the warehouse.
Follows certain steps to acquire the goods and services that the organization requires. Orders products or services, expedites the process, receives, and fulfills payment.

Understands the procedures for importing and exporting goods to and from other countries. Acquires all required permissions or licenses to ensure successful transactions and safe passage through customs.
Manages the fulfilment experience by ensuring that the customer's first experience is positive, from placing the order to fulfilling the order.
Processes daily sales tasks using the organization's preferred sales platform.
Uses local sourcing supply chain techniques to buy raw materials, components, services, and equipment from locally sustainable sources.
Maintains awareness of what is happening upstream in the supply chain and communicates this knowledge to both internal and external parties.
Avoids supply chain disruptions by bringing operations closer to where offerings are sold. Sources raw materials from domestic suppliers who are suitably located for manufacturing processes.
Manages the output of the sales team by setting objectives and measuring key results.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Plans and optimizes the physical movement of goods by using a logistics platform.

Keeps abreast with local and international trends, developments, and technologies within the transportation field. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates trends to ensure the organization's relevancy and competitiveness.
Understands the different models of transportation networks as well as their vulnerabilities. Chooses the best option for the organization's transport needs.
Keeps abreast with the various technological and electronic advancements made in traveling and vehicles and adjusts transportation strategies accordingly.

Ensures safety and security in the transportation of the organization's goods and products. Examines insurance liabilities and corporate and government policies to ensure compliance with safety regulations.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Examines all available distribution options and their impact on the environment. Opts for options that have the least damaging effect on the environment while still being cost-effective for the organization.

Forecasts/predicts the demand for products and services to manage and enable the organization to tailor capacity and meet variations in demand. Controls the level of demand using marketing or supply chain management strategies to allow smoothing of peaks in demand.

Manages and implements processes that help leadership focus on key supply chain drivers which include sales, new product introduction, marketing, inventory management, demand management, and production.

Segments and organizes the spend of different products or business units into a group according to how they are used, consumed, or purchased. Aims at producing business results and delivering value to a customer through the management of a category.
Manages the organization's fleet (e.g., commercial vehicles) performance, maintenance, and productivity.
Manages the supply of products and services to meet the forecasted client demand.

Checks the organization's fleet regularly for safety as well as maintenance/repair requirements. Prevents downtime or accidents by ensuring the fleet is in good working condition and meets all safety requirements.
Oversees all scheduled and unscheduled repairs of equipment. Ensures all equipment is always in a functional and reliable condition.
Plans route to enable the fastest travel between various locations.
Uses smart contract technologies for automatic invoice generation when shipment reaches destination and likely settles payments using cryptocurrencies automatically.

Uses robotic automated storage and retrieval processes to enhance operations that identify and receive orders, counts products, stores products and memorizes where items are located, and sends orders to the correct place.
Devises strategies to segment spend for similar or related products to maximize consolidation and efficiency.

Sources a vendor to whom supply chain services can be outsourced to minimize overall cost so the company can focus on the business's core competencies and meet customer demands effectively as well as gain greater flexibility in maintaining and operating the supply chain.

Focuses on building relationships with existing clients to transform them into key strategic accounts. Nurtures these relationships to either retain the clients' business or grow opportunities within the client account.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Improves the organization's market position and revenue growth through identifying and acquiring new clients and business opportunities.
Encourages the purchase of additional related products or services to an existing customer. Supplements or complements the purchase/s and provides additional benefit to the customer.
Develops a strategic approach for identifying new business opportunities. Engages these opportunities continuously until it either goes cold or leads to a sale.
Works remotely and sells organization's products/services using virtual channels. Engages in contactless interactions with potential clients.
Investigates and chooses the best channel/s to advertise and sell the organization's products/services. Measures the effectiveness of these channels and adjusts the approach accordingly.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops strategies that enable the sales team to sell more efficiently and at a greater velocity. Includes sales processes, access to content, onboarding and training, and progressive sales technologies and tools that supports their success.
Organizes a sales function to meet the business development goals of the organization. Executes effective sales plans and strategies.
Develops and implements policies and procedures that guide sales practices for both direct (raw materials and goods for production) and indirect (day to day) purchases.

Uses visual aids to showcase the organization's unique product/service offerings. Uses the opportunity to answer any questions or concerns the potential client might have to sway them more positively toward the product/service.
Estimates potential sales based on selling efforts and potential clients, in the various stages of the sales funnel.

Compiles a written document describing the offering of goods or services to prospective clients, demonstrating how to best meet their needs. Educates the prospective client on the key benefits and differentiating factors of the products/services and the organization.
Develops terms and conditions attached to the sale of goods or services. Ensures these are communicated clearly to a client in the relevant correspondence.
Upskills an organization's sales force in the sales cycle, from identifying prospects all the way through to closing the sale.

Keeps abreast with trends, developments, and technologies within the field of sales, both locally and internationally. Understands the impact of these on the organization. Incorporates relevant trends to ensure organization's relevancy and competitiveness.

Creates opportunities for customers to buy the organization's products/services using social media platforms. Monitors the performance of the organization's social commerce using built-in features on these social networks.
Uses social media channels to identify, listen, and engage with buyers to accelerate the sales process and increase revenue.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Encourages the purchase of a comparable higher-end version of what the customer intended to purchase.

Focuses on benefitting the customer throughout the sales process. Takes a consultative approach to provide value to the customer so the sales decision is made based on the potential value the product can provide.
Analyzes and understands a customer's requirements and pain points before recommending products and/or services that provide the solution.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Performs administrative tasks to support the sales team and help them to gain and keep customers. Monitors sales targets and records sales data.
Aligns the sales and marketing ventures of the business with each other. Works collaboratively.
Provides customers with the tools and resources needed to be successful. Gives them information to make well-informed decisions that puts them one step closer to achieving their goals.
Develops discounts and loyalty programs to deepen relationships with customers and keep them.
Understands the various generations and how it affects buying behavior. Adjusts sales strategies to each generation based on this knowledge.
Acquires new customers by persuading them to purchase a company's products and services.

Understands who the influencers are for your audience/market. Follows what influencers post about your organization, products, and services. Finds creative ways to shape their perceptions about your organization, products, and services.
Unifies sales channels and creates a single commerce experience that allows customers the freedom to choose where and how they get your product and service.
Surveys prospects to generate leads, engage with, qualify, conduct research, and communicate with potential customers.
Focuses on integrating the sales and marketing departments to function as one and create a plan that works toward the overall business goals.
Uses technology to automate mundane and administrative sales tasks to free up valuable professional time and ensure productivity.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Outsources sales activities to a dedicated sales firm to drive the sales of your products or services, allowing the organization to focus on its core business.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Increases brand visibility by providing webinars on thought-provoking topics relevant to the target market. Uses these opportunities to gather contact details to follow up with products or service-specific marketing to convert them into customers.

Uses multi-disciplinary teams to apply techniques that identify a product or service function, establish the worth of a function, and generate alternatives using creative thinking. Provides solutions at the lowest possible cost.

Researches, defines, and implements strategies to determine which distribution channels the company will use to achieve a specific objective. Provides a roadmap to get the products from the warehouse to customers, distributors, and end-users effectively and efficiently.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Applies sales tools and techniques to facilitate the sales process and position the company's solution as ideal before purchase.
Builds awareness of a product or service offering. Creates and converts leads into customers. Expands market share by entering new markets, growing customer engagement, and outperforming competitors.

Analyzes, reviews, and verifies the accuracy and completeness of commission payment reports. Ensures accurate and timely commission payments. Conducts cost analysis or modeling for alternative commission or incentive plan designs, or quota levels.
Identifies, develops, and implements policies and procedures. Informs staff of the administration of sales commission, incentive programs, quotas, etc.
Analyzes sales performance results. Prepares and delivers timely commission reports, presentations, and recommendations for management.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Manages the bid submission process from initial contact through to contract signing. Manages the timeline, subject matter experts, solicitation compliance requirements, and quality of the submission. Ensures the bid communicates the solution elements and win strategy.
Enables partners with the technical skills, materials, and information to sell a product or service. Vets and onboards partners, establishes sales targets, and ensures ongoing upskilling of partners.

Provides the skills, information, and support to ensure partners are equipped to sell the product or service on offer. Outlines training needs, evaluates training delivery options, and monitors impact.
Prepares and delivers technical presentations to explain products or services to customers. Sells scientific or technological products or services to customers.

Creates, manages and oversees sales territories to ensure efficient functioning. Matches sales representatives' skills to their territory and drives sales. Defines territories based on geography, sales potential, history or a combination of these factors.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Leverages digital capabilities and aligned strategic, marketing, and sales activities to approach the market and customers with targeted messaging, and enable business growth.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Develops strategies, solutions, and thought leadership to drive player engagement and build a high-performing team. Influences the extent to which players feel motivated and passionate and are emotionally committed and invested in the team.

Uses a database to keep all player applicant details. Includes previous applicants, sourced players, and referrals. Accesses this pool when opportunities arise and decides on best suitable players to engage.
Determines the gaps in a player's skills-set to better understand a player's developmental needs. Chooses best solution to bridge this gap to ensure the player can be effective and efficient.
Draws up plans to help players improve their skills and knowledge.
Implements training and development related processes, tasks, and projects to ensure that the training of players runs smoothly.
Measures and monitors the skills of people to develop team capability and align it with the organizational objectives.
Plans, organizes, and supervises the provision of services to team players.

Works as a team to deliver high quality, accurate and innovative scientific solutions and services that meet disease area and stakeholder needs; converts client and market requirements into products and services.
Aims to eliminate waste and the continual overuse of resources. Redefines growth through a positive impact on society.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Accepts and shows accountability in non-financial areas (e.g., social responsibility and sustainability). Accepts accountability for the company's employees and community members.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

competency_name: Environmental, Social, and Corporate Governance Investing
description: Develops investment strategies and portfolios that consider both financial returns and environmental, social, and corporate governance concerns.
Searches for and invests money into companies or investments that actively promote environmental responsibility.
Communicates the difference the company makes to the people they are trying to help, or to the issues the company is trying to improve, in a report format.

Focuses on and understands the interconnected relationships between a business and its customers, suppliers, employees, investors, communities and others who may have a stake in the organization. Uses this information to create value for all stakeholders.
Focuses on development that is in line with current business needs without depleting natural resources and compromising the ability of future generations to meet their needs.
Provides employees with access to training that raises their environmental awareness and climate literacy.
Builds own knowledge, skills, attitudes, and values to support the organization in being more sustainable and resource-efficient.

Installs, implements, maintains or uses a radio network that is distributed within a geographical radius through cells. Uses this cellular network to communicate through user equipment (i.e. mobile phones).
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.
Studies science to prevent, diagnose and treat diseases, disorders, and injuries in animals.
Designs and manufactures medicine to improve or maintain the health of animal species.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Complies with veterinary science operating principles, government regulations, and codes of ethics in animal healthcare-related situations. Provides healthcare to animals in a ways consistent with federal, state, and healthcare laws.
Diagnoses, performs surgery, and treats animal patients to ensure optimal health and wellness. Demonstrates professionalism, good communication, and respect for animals and their owners.

Uses methods to safely approach, manipulate, and calm animals. Uses specific restraint techniques to protect themselves and others from harmful animal behavior. Ensures that medical or related procedures such as medicating are performed effectively with minimal stress to the animal.
Understands the duty humans have to ensure that animals under their care are treated responsibly and humanely.
Diagnoses disease through the microscopic and molecular examination of organs, tissues, and whole-body post-mortems. Identifies abnormalities when diagnosing and managing treatment.
Considers the unique molecular signatures in complex biological mixtures that can be correlated to biological events in order to validate novel drug targets and predict drug response.
Knowledge of the major responsibilities, accountabilities, and organization of the legal function or department.

Optimizes the working relationship between employees, digital workers, and artificial intelligence. Helps employees understand the benefits of these technologies in the workplace.
Considers more factors than immediate profit or loss and makes business decisions in terms of environmental, social, and human impacts. Limits impacts on future generations to meet their needs.
Develops biological preparations to improve immunity to a particular disease.

Accepts and respects the individual differences of people. Displays an understanding of the uniqueness of all people and understands different cultures, values, opinions, generational differences, and belief systems. Has a mindset that all people have value and that all human differences must not be either bad or good.
Understands the nature of different business market operations, products or services, the immediate competition, vendors, and suppliers.

Takes action to meet own physical, mental, emotional, psychological, and social needs to maintain and improve overall well-being. It includes a range of intentional actions and practices aimed at reducing stress, promoting self-compassion, and ensuring prioritization of own physical and mental health.

Blends and balances own personal and professional life to create a cohesive, fulfilling, and flexible overall lifestyle. Aims to create a harmonious synergy between work-related demands and personal life, as opposed to rigidly separating them.

Maintains a clear and focused state of mind, free from mental clutter, distractions, and excessive stress or anxiety. Keeps a sharp and organized mental state to enable effective decision-making, problem-solving, and the capacity to manage life's challenges with a sense of calm and purpose.

Recovers from difficult experiences, maintains a positive outlook, and continues to thrive, demonstrating the capacity to bounce back, adapt, and grow stronger from challenging situations and experiences.

Optimizes a group's ability to work cohesively and efficiently toward shared goals and objectives. Fosters strong collaboration, open communication, and a harmonious team environment where members complement each other's strengths and compensate for areas of opportunity.
Uses computer technology in the design and manufacture of products.

Synthesizes artificial genes, repairs genes, combines deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) from two organisms (recombinant DNA), and manipulates the artificial genes together with the recombinant DNA to improve microbes, plants, animals, and human beings.
Screens trial participants extensively to design more targeted interventions, treatment plans, and therapies.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Uses a network of remote servers hosted on the Internet to store, manage, and process data. Develops and manages computer system resources which is available on-demand without direct, active management.
Identifies a customer's emotional needs, understands the reasons behind that need, and responds to it effectively and appropriately.
Develops networks that are capable of learning without human input from data that is unstructured or unlabeled.
Develops alternative and innovative strategies and solutions for meeting customers' needs through redefining problems and challenging assumptions about customers.
Has a deep understanding of all current and emerging technologies. Selects and uses appropriate digital tools and technologies to achieve a particular outcome.
Understands the fundamentals and mechanisms of digital operating systems. Develops and supports software for multiple operating environments.
Creates engaging messages using narratives. Gauges, finds, and captures the target audience and hooks them to a specified goal.

Quantifies information and sorts it for analysis. Analyzes data which may include investigating and highlighting trends, presenting, reporting on results, and providing conclusions and recommendations. Uses the appropriate tools (e.g., Excel) to conduct the analysis.

Identifies, locates, manipulates, formats, and presents data graphically to communicate relationships and insights. Helps the audience "see" the patterns or trends in the data with more clarity. Uses software (e.g., Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, HighCharts, Flare, and others).
Tailors experiences for customers based on the information learned about the customer through customer intelligence and predictive technology.
Collaborates with team members from different teams or functions to reach a common goal, or responsibility, or complete a project.
Compiles and submits documents to the relevant food and drug administration to request approval for marketing a new drug.
Collects evidence to determine the safety and effectiveness of a treatment intended for human use. Complies with all the relevant legislation on clinical trials.
Harnesses cellular and biomolecular processes to develop technologies and products. Manipulates microorganisms for the production of antibiotics, hormones, and so forth.
Studies tumors and medicine that specialises in the diagnosis of cancer, including medical, radiation, and surgical oncology.

Automates everyday tasks and processes performed in a drug safety or other healthcare setting. Mechanizes processes which could include medication dispensing, packaging, labeling, storage, and retrieval of medications.

Strictly applies the scientific method to ensure robust and unbiased experimental design, methodology, analysis, and interpretation of results. Provides transparency in reporting so that others can reproduce and extend findings.
Uses this tool/technology effectively during the delivery of day-to-day tasks.

Uses various digital health care methods and/or technology to remotely diagnose, observe, consult with, and treat patients. These can include but may not be limited to technology such as smartphones, laptops, wearables, and streaming services.
Identifies a new drug and develops it to bring it to market.

Understands the pharmaceutical industry. Focuses on the discovery, development, producing, and marketing of drugs or pharmaceutical drugs for use as a medication, to be administered to cure, vaccinate, or alleviate symptoms.
Discovers, evaluates, registers, monitors, and deals with the clinical aspects of pharmaceutical development.

Enforces practicing social distancing in the workplace, restricts visitors to facilities, encourages the practice of good hygiene, and ensures employees are healthy and fit for work before allowing them on the job.
Understands the basic operations and functions of Excel. Uses Excel software to achieve the organization's goals.

Strikes a good balance between the required levels of pressure and stress required for an individual to perform optimally. Identifies triggers that push an employee beyond their stretched zone and problem-solves solutions to mitigate these triggers.

competency_name: Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) Strategy and Policy
description: Devises a diversity and inclusion (D&I) strategy and supporting policy, to ensure the organization has a sound plan for reaching its goals and guiding principles on how to achieve them. Ensures everyone is trained on the policy and compliance is monitored.
Keeps abreast with employer-related laws and trends of diversity. Attracts and selects diverse candidates. Educates management on the benefits of having a diverse team.
Studies the physiological functioning of the immune system in all organisms, in states of both health and disease.
Develops and maintains the architecture that helps analyze and process data in the way the organization needs it.
Researches, designs, applies, and evaluates new information technologies for business environments.

Understands common software architectures, including layered, distributed, and micro-service architecture models. Recommends the best model to use and participates in the technical and functional design of software products.
Designs, writes, tests, debugs/troubleshoots, and maintains the source code of computer programs. Ensures alignment with software products' requirements and specifications.

Reduces hardware assets or uses them more efficiently by running multiple "virtual machines" side by side on the same hardware, emulating different components of the Information Technology (IT) systems.

Develops solutions for the organization or its client that helps computers understand, interpret, and manipulate human language. Has deep-seated knowledge in computer sciences and computational linguistics.
Develops computer programs and algorithms that can generate new content (e.g., text, imagery, audio, and synthetic data) that resembles existing data.

Designs, develops, evaluates, tests, and optimizes textual or verbal cue prompts for data inputs for artificial intelligence (AI) models. Helps to train AI models to address specific tasks and make accurate decisions and predictions.

Identifies and captures opportunities in fast-changing global markets. Ensures the organization adapts its strategies, operations, and product/service offerings to stay relevant and ahead of the curve and a leader in the industry.

Adopts the evolution of values, behaviors, and capabilities. Assists the business in becoming adaptive, creative, and resilient when dealing with complexity, uncertainty, and change leading to improved well-being and better outcomes.

Uses Good Automated Manufacturing Practice (GAMP) as a guideline to maintain operational efficiency and reliability. Uses GAMP to interpret regulatory standards for improved compliance, quality, efficiency, and cost reductions.
Uses Artificial Intelligence (AI), robots, 3D printing, etc., to optimize the manufacturing operations and processes.
Manages projects within Information Technology (IT) or other functions in a highly flexible and interactive manner, in line with best practice agile principles.
Leads a product from the conception phase through to launch, focusing on features, business value, and the customer.

Ensures the supply chain is flexible and adaptive and can respond effectively to the changes in the environment, customer preferences, competitive forces, etc. Creates and preserves the organization's competitive advantage. Focuses on speed, cost efficiency, responsiveness, flexibility, and productivity in the production and delivery of goods.
Applies technological advancements to the Supply Chain Management (SCM) process to ensure efficiency and optimization.
Uses electronic platforms to requisition, order, and purchase goods and services from suppliers and partners.

Identifies key information and data as well as relationships between different pieces of information. Uses business-related data presented in graphs, tables, and reports to generate solutions to a variety of problems, using statistical or other spreadsheeting skills.
Understands budgeting, financial forecasting, cost management, analysis, and reporting for a specific business unit or function.
Mitigates short-term risks and remains flexible to make immediate and strategic adjustments in times of turmoil.
Stretches beyond core strengths and the discipline of work. Moves beyond one's comfort zone and continuously updates knowledge in new areas.

Presents confidently to small or large groups, leveraging technology, and providing an engaging experience to the audience. Structures presentation, designs slides, and conveys the message through effective use of tone and body language.

Perceives, interprets, and acts in a way that demonstrates self and social awareness. Recognizes and responds appropriately to the feelings, thoughts, and behaviors of others to effectively navigate social interactions.

Understands how gestures, tone of voice, facial expressions, and body posture can be used to communicate with others. Correctly interprets the nonverbal cues of others and is aware of own nonverbal messages.

Understands the importance and benefits of mindfulness. Uses breathing techniques, guided imagery, and other practices to relax the body and mind, stay aware and present in the moment, and help reduce stress.
Plans, designs, coordinates, manages, and improves the process of moving goods.

Prioritizes the purchasing of products and services that do minimal damage to human lives, society, and the environment. Develops sourcing, relationship management, and risk exposure minimization strategies to reflect the organization's convictions.
Works with suppliers and builds long-term relationships. Aids suppliers in determining improvements that can have a measurable and positive financial impact for both organizations.
Leverages digital channels to find, engage, and connect with prospective buyers. Builds digital relationships with the aim to turn online connections into offline sales conversations.
Identifies and utilizes energy sources that are constantly replenished naturally and don't become depleted when used.

Devises strategies to maximize the revenue and profits of an organization's brand and product portfolio over time. Predicts consumer behavior, optimizing product pricing, promotions, and availability to eliminate ineffective spending.
Redesigns or rethinks core business models and/or processes to radically shift efficiency, productivity, or quality.

Work towards continuously improving products, services, or processes. Plans and implements change. Checks data to analyze the results of the change and whether it made a difference. Implements it on a wider scale if effective.
Performs charitable acts or other good works, such as donating money to a worthy cause, volunteering time and effort, or setting up a foundation that helps others or society.
Captures shared knowledge to collaboratively pursue organizational objectives. Encourages continuous reflection and proactively builds a collective knowledge and skill base within the organization.
Uses a mental process to intentionally store information in memory, often through repetition or association, for later recall or recognition.
Perceives, stores, and recalls visual information. Uses the brain's ability to remember and recognize images, colors, shapes, and spatial arrangements from past experiences.
Analyzes, interprets, and draws conclusions from visual information or spatial relationships to enable problem-solving, conceptual understanding, and decision-making.
Directs and maintains focused attention on a specific task, activity, thought, or problem, while minimizing distractions or interruptions.

Plans ahead and makes arrangements to guarantee the fulfillment of obligations within a rigid timetable. Ensures timely attendance to appointments and the submission or completion of assignments and tasks according to established or agreed-upon deadlines.
Adheres to a repeated sequence of behaviors that do not require conscious effort or thought, and which minimizes the unpredictability of work or everyday life.
Perceives, distinguishes, and concentrates on the world through the senses, enhancing one's ability to engage with and understand the environment.

Implements and maintains quality assurance measures to ensure accuracy, reliability, and compliance with regulatory and industry standards across all laboratory operations.

Develops assessment centers aligned with organizational objectives and competency requirements. This entails designing or selecting assessment exercises (e.g., interviews, psychometric tests, group exercises, role plays, and simulations), defining assessment/scoring criteria, coordinating logistics, training, and stakeholder engagement.

description: Applies a deep understanding of medical procedures, including regulatory guidelines and safety standards, to design advanced electrical and robotic systems for medical settings. Integrates cutting-edge technologies to ensure these systems meet regulatory standards, optimizing safety, functionality, and reliability to enhance device efficacy and patient outcomes.
Builds partnerships with various stakeholders (e.g., other organizations, community groups, government entities, and individuals) to achieve common goals or address shared challenges.
Strives to exceed others' performance. Evaluates own performance in comparison to others. Prefers a competitive goal-oriented environment.

Oversees the strategic planning, organization, and control of the engineering design process in projects or organizations, aligning it with the overarching objectives. Manages the drafting tasks for a project, ensuring inter-departmental collaboration, record-keeping compliance, and thoughtful material, machinery, or equipment selection.
Designs and/or installs heat pumps. Configures and connects the heat pump's components, including the compressor, evaporator, condenser, and refrigerant lines, to facilitate efficient heat transfer.
Collects and analyzes intelligence derived from foreign targets' radars, weapons, and communication systems. Uses this to determine foreign adversaries actions and capabilities.

Creates diverse and appealing menus by strategically planning and creating food and beverage offerings. Considers culinary and business trends, customer preferences, and cost management when developing the menu.
Uses a system that contains a series of interconnected operations, or integrated computerized functions, to streamline the input and retrieval of information.
Determines whether a claim of patent infringement falls under infringement or literal infringement.
Determines whether products, technologies, or inventions infringe on another parties' patent claims or other existing Intellectual Property (IP) rights.

Coordinates legal cases to promote their smooth progression within the legal system. This may include handling procedural details, deadlines, evidence management, and court appearances, all aimed at expediting the legal process, ensuring fairness, and achieving prompt case resolution.
Evaluates and reviews proposed legislation or existing laws and regulations. Ensures that the legislation is in line with legal principles, policy objectives, and societal needs.

Follows a legal process of building and presenting a case against individuals or entities accused of committing crimes, including investigation, evidence presentation, and adherence to legal procedures.
Ensures effective process management lifecycle through process implementation and monitoring specified processes to enhances organizational efficiencies.

Designs, tests, debugs and implements software packages that aid in the process of electronic communications.
Designs, installs, implements, and maintains the wireless infrastructure network of the organization. Troubleshoots wireless network problems.

competency_name: Industry Wi-Fi standards and Best Practices
description: Creates, implements and uses formal disciplines, practices, and standards for improving the effectiveness, efficiency and accessibility of Wi-fi procedures and policies.
Develops the hardware used to transmit data and information between a sending and receiving device.

Identifies opportunities to cultivate strong relationships with stakeholders in the market.  
Develops a robust network focused on delivering value to customers and achieving business success.

Develops and implements strategic plans for managing assets throughout their lifecycle to maximize efficiency, minimize costs, mitigate risks, ensure sustainability, and align with organizational goals.
Ensures critical tasks are reviewed and approved by at least two individuals, supports risk mitigation and accountability, and maintains control integrity to prevent errors and fraud.

Develops, implements and/or maintains policies and procedures that guide occupational pension fund practices. Ensures that pension funds operate lawfully, ethically, and in the best interest of beneficiaries.

Applies International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) to ensure accurate, transparent and consistent financial reporting. Understands IFRS principles, financial statement preparation, regulatory compliance, and technical accounting treatments across various industries.

Applies open source practices to proprietary code within an organization, fostering collaboration by making internal projects accessible to all employees. This approach enables code reuse, minimizes redundancy, and empowers teamwork across the organization, helping establish an open source-like culture while retaining software for internal use.

Develops sales plans to drive the organization's growth/revenue objectives by leveraging understanding in market trends and the macro environment . Leverages market data from internal and external sources, resulting in an integrated plan that addresses customer’s priorities  and maximizes customer access.

Identifies, sources, and initiates potential business opportunities or transactions. It involves finding new deals, assessing their viability, and initiating discussions with potential partners or clients to develop and structure agreements, often with the goal of driving growth or expansion for the organization.
Conducts a review process that analyzes and evaluates performance after an event, project, or operation.
Estimates expected credit losses (ECL) for groups of financial assets using statistical modeling and risk assessment techniques.
Designs, structures, and implements financing arrangements that help individuals, businesses, or organizations manage and address their debt obligations.
Utilizes financial tools that allow organizations or individuals to raise capital or borrow money. Tools include bonds, loans, notes, commercial paper or certificates of deposit (CD).
Reorganizes debt obligations to make them more manageable and sustainable ensuring individuals or organizations can navigate financial difficulties, protect assets, and avoid insolvency.

Understands the application of sanctions regulations to ensure compliance with international laws and prevent financial crimes. Carries out various sanctions related tasks such as, management of sanctions lists, transaction monitoring, and risk assessments.
Identifies and reports U.S. account holders, supports due diligence and data collection, and maintains updated FATCA controls to ensure compliance and minimize risk.
Obtains official authorization to operate in the construction industry, ensuring compliance with legal, safety, and professional standards.
Studies the movement, distribution, and management of water in the environment, including rainfall, rivers, groundwater, and their interactions with ecosystems and human activities.

Ensures models are developed, validated, and monitored according to policies, regulations, and best practices. Establishes a structured framework to manage model risks, enhance transparency, and maintain accountability throughout the model lifecycle.
Designs, tests and builds quantitative models in an iterative way until the model meets the desired criteria. Uses the model to gain insights from data.
Uses clinical knowledge and clinical evidence to influence key decision-makers and clinical practice in support of customers

Utilizes and contributes to code that is publicly available for use, modification, and redistribution in accordance with open source licenses. Applies best practices to ensure compliance with organizational policies related to security, licensing, and software governance.

Competitively sells the organization's products or services by understanding the customer’s needs and priorities and driving behavior change.  Presents a solution that results in a closed sale (new sale, cross and/or up-sell).
